mnasses beniamin least north tribe da nepthaly midst foure battallions marched priest leuites bearing arke couenant sacred vessel foure head principall conducters iuda ruben ephraim colonell hoast battalion colonell whole iuda dazur cest bleu celeste au lyon rampant dor ruben de gueulles belic cest la couleur rouge lhomme arme argon colonel tribe describd armes colour cheefe leader ephraim de blew red greene blacke mettall vpon mettall colour vpon colour false armes quartered otherwise subiect question good beeing priuiledged prince soueraigne lordes giuen vnto particular men graunt false deserue name armes foolery foppish deuises eight tribe standard answereable colour colonell different charge agreeable greatnesse standard tribe theyr armes isachar portoit azur lasne passant argent zabulon azur au nauire arme frette argent rubens hoast simeon portoit de gueulles deux espees argent en sautour gad gaue likewise de gueulles lespee argent mise en pal la point enchant vnder ephraim manasses qui portoit de sable au scepter couronne hee eldest sonne patriarch ioseph hee first lotte land promise appertained royaltie priesthood whereof despoyled honoured father beniamin portoit de sable au loup passant dargent vnder tribe dan aser qui portoit de synople seme despics de ble dor nepthali de synople au cerf somme dor thus remarked rabbines place alledged second chapter booke number first second verse loquutus est dominus um mose aarone dicens singuli iuxta vexillvm suum sub signis domus patrum suorum castra ponant filij israel e regione circuitu tabernacu foederis castra pona lord spake moses aaron saying euery man child israel shall campe standard vnder ensigne father house farre tabernacle congregation shall pitch passage interprete nine fortieth chapter genesis ick plate high priest garnished twelue precious stone engrauen name armes tribe israel adde beside iosuah hauing caused child israel passe ouer floodiordane dry foote procured euery one place great stone vpon banke sayde flood highest boundes thereof earned name armes twelue tribe serue signale memorie vnto posteritiethe stone bankes iordan bearing name armes tribe myraculous passage twelue stone time sauiour christ conuersed among men serued title proofes nobility among iewes declare extraction saint iohn speaketh stone reprehending people dissolute depraued liues third chapter saint mathewes gospell polens est deu de l dictus st suscitare abraha god able euen stone rayse vp child abraham saul like manner appointed bee king ouer child israel tooke armes kingdome ensigne colonell tribe beniamin whereof descended dauid called place one worthier hee tooke tribe iuda whereunto patriarch iaacob dauid armes tribe iuda transferred right eldershippe appurtenance royaltie priesthoode saide nine fortieth chapter genesis eight nine verse iuda te laudabunt fratres tui manus tua ceruicibus inimicorum tuorum adorabunt te filij patris tui thou iuda thy brother shall praise thee thine hand shall bee necke thine enemy thy father sonnes shall bow downe vnto thee patriarkeiudaes armes blazoned father blazoning armes sonne iuda rabbines deuise bee dazur au lyon rampant dor saide iuda requiescens accubuisti vt leo quis suscitabit eum shall couch downe lyon lyonnesse shall stirre vp dauid taking lyon armes caused bee engrauen signet seale royall yea monies helde currant course vntill declination iewish estate according set downe rabbi abraham historicall cabala armes conserued great king salomon blazoning thirtie chapter prouerbes saith amongest creature earth three doe exceede surpasse rest also hee compareth prince thus tria sunt quae bene gradiuntur pr quartum quod incidet foeliciter leo fortissimus bestiarum ad nullius pauebit occursum gallus succinctus lumbos aries nec est rex qui resistat ei lyon king beast hath alwayes beene symbole royaltie generositie conioyned clemencie neuer running beast humble like manner good prince hae illi erunt artes parcere subiectis debellare superbos verie height anger hee qualifieth himselfe soone lambe present symbole mildenesse clemencie cause diuine poet du bartas made lyon schoolemaster princesthe lyon potus anulo vindicantur rapina plautus mother family keepe h selfe priuy theeues went herselfe market going forth house lockt made fast cubbords place charge obsignat cell referte anulum ad whereof seruant complained detesting dilligence requisite housekeeping locke vp thing vnder key euen saltseller plantus affirmeth isti parcipromi qui saliuum seruis obsignant cum sale marshall ninth epigrame nunc signat meus anulus lagenam diligence clemens alexandrinus approueth commendeth christian woman third booke institution dat foeminis anulum aureum nec eum quidem ad ornamentum sed vt ea obsignent quae doni digna sunt quae custodiantur propteres quod domus cura ad ca pertineat si enim rectam paedagogi institutionem omnes probe sequrentur ni il opus esset signaculis cum omnes essent ex aequo iusti serui domini sed quoniam ignorantia mala educatio praebet occasionem propensionis ad iniuriam fuit op sigillis passage well deserueth translated english reason ring gold giuen christ womanit capi quibus celeberrimi sunt sicambri sweu sicambrian sworn enemie romainesso romaine historian neuer speake sueues sicambrians marched along field keepe company coniured enemy romaine banded people hate onely oppresse bring seruitude slauery neere neighbouring caused wholly conforme fashion manner life mutuall conserue libertie expulse romaine plenteous gaules become master themselues tacitus telleth germania eadem causa semper germanis transcendendi gallia mutand dis amor vt relictis paludibus meaneth sicambrians solitudi suis sueues foecundissimum galliarum solum possiderent sicambrians obserued yellow haire tressed knit cordo like loue knot ribband saith martiall crinibus nodum tortis venere sicambri claudian ante ducem nostrum flauam sparsere sicambri caesariem againe third panegyrick stilico saith haec alemannorum spolijs australibus illo ditior exuuis illinc flauente sicambri caesaria sidonius apollinaris saith et flauis pocula fracte sicambris rhene umens sueues tacitus saith insigne gentis obliquare crinem nod que stringere lucane second pharsalia fundit ab extremo flauos aquilone sueuos albis claudian first booke arduus flauis signabat iura sueuis true originall gauleswhich declareth confirmeth haue formerly said people originall gaules butt aime wholly tended regaine gaule whence departed constant case testimonie ammianus marcellinus gaules beard hair yellow like gold tressed knit cordon latine poet eight aenei speaking gaules colonie passing italie rased rome vnder reigne ambigat saith galli per dumos aderant aciesque tenebant defensi tenebris dono noctis opacae aurea caesaries ollis aurea vestis caesaries long locke haire yellow gold beard coloura captaine withou beard called inuestis called vestem auream captaine without beard tearmed inuestis doth seruius atheneus tell v dypnos p istes de caena celtarum claudian second booke eutropium tum flaua repexo gallia crin fer x reuinctaque crine decoro come name allemaignes french concerning name frenchsome would deriue name french latine wo excellence feritas ferocitas thence feroces franci fer ci e grounding aduenture passage strabo purposely reported gaul colony planted germanie nationem gallicam imitantes feritatis antia proceritate corporum colore flauo truth ammianus marcellinus de cribeth man woman gaule white flesh broad shoulder gold ellow haire tall strong body stature roman standing seemed dwarfes pigmeies falling chance heir sleeues heereupon gaulish woman made mockery dwarfes diminitiues men saith caesar bello gallico aboue hey dreadfull countenance city higher pannonia gaue battell victory maximus foyled emperor theodosius maximus fled safety aquileia brauely pursued city narrowly besieged owne souldiers reuolting seized person cloathing imperiall garment fast bound manacled deliuered emperour theodosius hee milde mercifull prince would haue beene gracious maximus tyrant death souldiers guard plucking violently cut head sixt calends treuers nannius quintinus commander horseman vnto tyrant maximus comitted charge son also gouernment gaules hauing brought forc field came succour cologne french laden rich spoyles passed backe againe ouer riuer rhine hauing left good troupe romanes land resolued pursue former purpose make h cke alla g ber french e romane fell otherwise romanes followed rere hauing ouertaken charboniere forrest gaue checkmate slew great number romaneanimated exalted courage sate councell deliberation whether better crosse rhine mean enter france nannius wise politique captaine could allow aduise alleadging reason euident appearance frenchman forecast b ing prepared welcome romanes vndoubtedly would winne aduantage regard stronger owne ground quintin quite contrary nannius opinion nothing pleasing companion quintinus followed direction nannius hauing made retreat maguntia quintinus armie went encamp neere castle nuz afterward passed rhine second lodging vpon passage quintinus follower found townes forsaken withdrawing themselues thick st part wood great wayes passage whereof bound fast spreading branch tree knitting intricately strong knot one within another silly reuenge ken romanesthe rom n fond foolish reuenge set village cottage fire onely meere despight found victualls signe trophy triumphes straw remaining night armour yet discouering person abou breake day conducted colonell quintinus entered beating wood continued hemd till one day misled p th passage infinite toyle trauell found meanes free themselues combined branch yet met worse fortune vulgar prouerbe isthe romanes v nat pro ion fell feauer disease farre greater danger issuing forth forrest came wide open fieldes marishes entrance side french purposely hidden themselues within wood onely draw romanes myery field trembling earth full bogges quagmire wherein romanes much pestered appeared frenchman top tree serued many exalted tower turret discouery enemy draw neere let flie dart arrowes embalmed venemous hearbs custome frenche impoyson dart arrowesthe french ed po oned dart wh rewith greatly annoyed roman noted salique law first paragraphe title de vulner bus lead like vnto thicke darke clowd breaketh hayle stormie raine euen chanced poore romanes rather much worse arrowes fell vpon skinne pierced fe ered immediately died rauing violence poyson meanes french knew best warrantable ground assembled great number engirting romane armie made terrible slaughter first rankes horse ingulfed bogges men horse beast carried charge luggagethe miserable perple ity romanes deepely swallowed myres meanes serued drawing likewise rest followed step subiect like successe foot souldiers agile light horseback although bemudded soyled filth moist field yet difficultie got thence escaped wood whence issued morning hiding themselues among bush till night came hath neither shame feare sheltered fauour thereof best manner could deuise possible whole armie thus confused rankes disorder saue themselues need demanded french safetie well reuenged charboniere forrest great good market enemy heraclius maister campe du regiment legion iouinians command armie remained dead saued themselues dayes misfortune small number heare auouched sulpitius alexander third booke historie fourth booke speaketh death victor last yongest sonne tyran maximus time place sted nannius quintinus subrogated two captaines named carietto surius three distinction concerning germanie army encamped themselues face face france vpon confines germanie must vnderstood first germanie side rhine allemaigne beyond elb germanie afterward call franconia saith afterward french intruded themselues againe germanie doubtlesse first brought away thence vnspeakeable bootie arbogastes vnwilling endure brauadoes nothing else griefe familiar wondred said marcomir thing succeede thee well thou canst wish hauing grace fauour holy man could say sunne stand still stood still word paulinus per idem tempus arbogastes come aduersus gentem suam hoc est francorum bellum parauit atque pugnando non paruam multitudinem manu fudit cum residuis vero pacem firmauit sed cum conuiuio regibus gentis suae interrogaretur vtrum sciret foure encounter one king godegisilus shine field twenty thousand people perishing edge sword french vandales bin quite foyled alanes came time greatest neede brought succour passed riuer rhine company thus enstructed historian renatus profuturus frigeridus reported gregory tour yeare foure hundred eleuen vnder consulship emperour east theodosius yonger fourth time without consull west ouerwhelmed misery man named constantine simple souldiour constantine silly souldior made emperour exalted emperor garrison england time alaricus desquieted italie sought also make himselfe maister italie ad already done gaules england spaine regencie prouince hee giuen sonne constantius hee likewise proclaimed companion empire saith sozomenus ninth booke constantius come spaine left wife constantius sonne constantine gouerning spain furni ure sarragossa capitall citie arragon lieutenant one named gerontius hee went parlee father arles prouence vpon sub ect voyage italie agreed one opinion percei ing italie none would stirre constantine gaue himselfe dissolute course life aduised sonne returne backe againe spaine hauing guide conuoye taken certaine troupe well appoin ed souldiours make way yet remained fa receiued newes spaine gerontius caused proclaimed emperour one named maximus intimate endeared friendsone vsurpes ri eth armes another kept imperiall seate tarragona catalogna prepared lieutenant decimus rusticus maister office conductor puissant armie consisting french alemanes french led two heir duke called marcomir ingomer brethten descended italie gaule went besiedge tyrant constantine within citie arles gerontius already held moneths siege constrained raise armie honorius droue disorder hee made retraite haste towards spaine hee laine owne souldiours held contempt reason flight siedge arles proceeded constantius aduertised edobeccus duke french frigeridus calleth sozomenus deriue narration amply yea perticularly frige idus saith approched neere great supply granted counted night day ipso placito quanticum que fuerint qui rem itertiatam put third hand moueables tearmed guardian sequester fruit contentious benefice vendiderint aut cambiauerint exchange aut fortasse solutionem dederint omnes intra placitum istum commoneantur assigned summoned vt vnusquis que cum negotiatoribus suis alter alterum admoneat si quis vero commonitus fuerit aliqua sunni exoine eum non detinuerint ad placitum venire distulerit tunc ille qui cum eo negotiauit habeat tres testis quod enuntiasset vt ad placitum venire debuisset alios tres testis similiter habeat quod cum eo publice negotiasset hoc si ficere exiu se de latrocinio ille autem qui admonitus non venerit per quem te e iurauerint erit latro illius qui re suas agnoscit ei secundum legem ipsas componat insuper meroueus king french bourgongnons vuisigothes maximus clearesighted outwardly maintaining himselfe empire yet starke blinde himselfe saith procopius could containe tonguethe malice woman implacable one night reuealed maine secret wife eudoxia concerning practises compassing death valentinian wife arising breake day disposed selfe reuenged wrought meanes sent trustie friend affrica gensericus king vandales offering empire west would come speedily reuenge death husband valentinian presently set saile italie got possession rome without resistance maximus surprized vnawares beaten downe blowes stone wherewith mangled piece way able helpe himselfe according bishop auuergne writeth epistle ad serranum second booke afterward remarkeable lesson well aduised prince neuer serue owne turne strange succour vnder colour taking reuenge ordenarily teareth eye body mindes seeke assistance gensericus robbed burned rome carrying affrica called helpe two daughter eudoxia placida also treasure westerne emperor saith procopius second booke vandale warres thirtie dayes death tyrant maximus legion gaule exalted auitus empire whereof enioying vntill yeare foure hundred fiftie sixe hauing reigned ten moneths eight dayes constrained disordered life renounce empire placentia written gregory tour historie france second booke eleauenth chapter death empire vacant ten moneths fifteene dayes next succeeded maiorian tumult continued west empire meroueus sat hand benummed armes crossefoulded taking owne aduantage occasion forelocke possessed himselfe extendure countrey betweene riuers somme infinite number false historian deriue greatest house europe descent ligne clodion giue greater aduantage precedency honor meerely imaginarythe errour diuers author historian set downe painting aboue monarch lillie bring naturall egitimate possession within compasse compromise continually perpetuated twelue hundred yeares hitherto without let intermission bert sena originallherein likewise may seene impertinency honoring king second third ligne descended ansbert called romaine senatour albeit gaule borne nation great lord austrasia lorraine doe fetch birth originall said king clodion feigning transport thence rome made senatour auoide furie clouis wholly bent totall ruine collaterall kinred also vtterly ignorant time rome emperours italie subiected vnder command seigneurie arrian ostrogothes king theodoricke knew ansbert howsoeuer named senatour naturall gaule haue already said shall doe elsewhere romaine whole power romaine gaulepro ed ga le borne romaine quite quenched clouis according wee haue formerly obserued clouis make yet discouery whether kinred one day good company feigning complaine death bin dispatcht world himselfethe ssembling plain king clouis spake thus vnhappy man quoth thus left alone like vnto poore pilgrime among stranger haue one kinsman left helpe disaster fortune whatsoeuer else inconuenience happen vnto spake saith gregory tour grieuing bin death kinred rather mallice deceit try remained aliue might likewise rid hoc non de merte parentum condolens sed dolo dicebat si forte potuisset adhuc aliquem reperire vt interficeret shew iustice slaine ground fortie thousand flemmings side firebrand sedition arteuelle himselfe king follower three fortie person king day battaileafter battaile king vnckles went church denys tooke oriflambe fourescore three men gaunt againe reuolted de english king resolued goe fight departed paris came denys heard masse receiued oriflambe gaue messire guy de la trimouille valiant knight receiued augustus hand deputy receiuing regales archbishop rheims whereof heere followeth true tenure tenure regale homines de burgo sancti rhemigij rhemensis fecerunt domino regi fidelitatem hac forma ipsi two hundred fortie many pound fauour eudes de sully cousine germaine king whose picture tombe seene potin placed betweene doore quire pulpet church paris bishoppe successour maurice custome reduced summe threescore parisian poundsthe parisian pound starling remarkeable decree tenure whereof followeth serue light posteritie tenure decree made court parliament philippus dei gratia francorum rex omnibus praesentibus pariter atque futuris notum sit quod no inspeximus chartas patris nostri nostram quibus continebatur quod no hominibus episcopi parisiensis extra parisius non poteramus talliam accipere vel exactionem facere quae excederet numerum sexaginta librarum parisiensium nec illam accipere poteramus nisi statuto tempore episcopo debitam quia vero vacante sede parisiensi defuncto bonae memoriae mauritio quondam episcopo parisiensi hominibus episcopi accipimus summam ducentarum quadraginta librarum aut amplius vltra praedictas sexaginta libra ad petitionem dilecti consanguinei fidelis nostri odonis parisiensis episcopi concessimus quod quando regalia manum nostram vel successorum nostrorum deuenient ea quae no aut ministeriales nostri accipiendo vltra praedictam summam sexaginta librarum exigere fecimus nullum episcopo parisiensi vel ecclesiae parisiensi posterum inferre praeiudicium aut grauamen nec hominibus episcopi extra parisius sicut supradictum est no vel successores nostri aliquid de cetero poterimus accipere vel requirere vltra praedictam summam sexaginta librarum pro tallia vel exactione quod vt perpetuum c datum apud sanctum germanum laia anno domini millesimo ducentesimo septimo regni nostri anno vigesimo septimo dapifero nullo signum guidonis buticularij mathei camerary drogonis constabularij data vacante cancellaria per manum fratris writing wee haue vnder owne hand vpon king soueraigne interposed authoritie lewes deuout seuenth name whose letter patent may heere reade registred said court nomine sanctae indiuiduae trinitatis amena true coppy king letter patent ego ludouicus dei gratia francorum rex notum facimus vniuersis clericos nostros carnotenae ciuitatis existentes adhuc n desolatione quam acciperant ex morte bonae memoriae episcopi gosleni nostram adiuisse iam serenitatem humiliter expostulasse quantinus praeceptum aui nostri regis phi ippi philip first name no iamdictae ecclesiae confirmaremus enor igitur priuilegij talis esse dignoscitur regem philippum notum facere vniuersis regno franciae per futura tempora successuris quod domnus yuo sanctae carnotensis ec lesiae venerabilis episcopus humili deuotione celfitudinem suae serenitatis adierit ob ixe deprecans vt prauam consuetudinem domibus episcopalibus eiusdem ecclesiae comite henrico cognomento stephano adela vxore eius concessiene filicrum suorum guillelmi theobaldi odonis stephani remissam libertatem praedictis mibus rebus eisdem collectis praedictis comitibus collatam concederet et sua pragmatica sanctione firmaret cuius pio desiderio assentiens aequissima postulat aurem inclinans secundum tenorem scripti quod de praedictis rebus praetaxati comites ieri decreuerunt suae sacrae maiestatis auctoritate rex praetaxatas praua consuetudine liberauit domum scilicet domus eiusdem ferrum plumbum vitrum lignum lapides caeteramque supellectilem scilicet stabulas scamna scabella vas vinaria lectos nec coquinas horrca granaria cellaria torcularia furnos furnorumque domos siue vrbe siue extra vrbem syluas vt non vendantur nec succidantur nec dentur ann quoque vinum foenum oues boues caetera animalia omniaque reliqua mobilis que congregata sunt vel collecta fuerunt siue vrbe siue extra vrbem ante obitum discessum episcopi cuiuslibet intacta manere firmauit illis profutura quibus episcopium reseruare vel donare seu per se seu per oechonomum suum eadem sacrum maiestis dicti decreuerit vel maiores persona ecclesiae si id episcopo aliqua occasione praeuento facere non licuerit concedimus etiam vt exactio quae defunctis episcopis vel discendentibus fien solet seruientes episcopi vel rusticos de caetero nunquam fiat haec omnia sicut pr dictis comitibus concessum est firmatum ipse praedictus rex vt praedictum est ce cessit per pragmaticam sanctionem suam firmauit no autem clericorum eiusdem ecclesiae aud ta suscepta postulatione haec omnia eis eundem modum immobilit atque perpetu sicut praedictus auus noster philippus rex francorum concessimus nostri sigilli auctoritate sirmauimus nominis caractere testificati sumus datu publice parisius anno domini adstantibus quorum nomina subscripta sunt gna signum laudunensis magistri galteri de mauritannia de mortaign mortagne grangias curtes carrucas greges armenta de quibuscunque animalibus vineas de campo britonis de clauso iuxta brolium ipsum brolium vineas de p aco alias etiam vineas quascunque plantauerit siue acquisiuerit omnino omne insta mentum suum libertate donauimus perpetuum ipsius etiam petitione omnes eiusdem successores ea auctoritate posuimus vt tempore vindemiarum ad reficiendas vineas de fructu earum tantum residui conseruetur cultoribus reddatur quod earum culturae sficiat libertate quorum donauimus domos episcopi de lauduno quascunque extra l duno quascun que extra laudunum habet quidquid eisdem domibus consistit de l gno filo de ferro vitro aere de quacunque alia materia hoa autem rali regio pro euidentia rerum posterum pro conseruando eiusdem libertatis tu inserere dignum duximus quod decedens episcopus sicut testatus fuerit ratum eri et si decesserit intestatus quod absit regij iuris erit aurum eius argentum totum nona tota excepta illa quam custodes granchiarum magistri carrucarum retinebunt seminandos agros ad sufficienter sustentandum se seruientes necessarios sibi imalia sua similiter vinum ab intestato episcopo remanens totum regij iuris erit excep vino illo quod de vineis acquisitis vel plantatis praefato episcopo fuerit quod sane vi nostrum non erit sed inde praenuncupati episcopi soluentur debita sinulla sunt reseruabitur vinum successoribus porro post decessum episcopi episcopatu veniente regiam seruientes de parte regis venientes non stabunt domibus lauduni nec domibus vbi munitiones non erunt sed alijs locis vbi munitiones sunt ipsi ministr regij munitionib manebunt ad custodiam earum distrahendis rebus episcopi pr dicti quas libertate donauimus vel ordinando vel vsus suos assumendis potesta carebunt sed illi potius seruientes ministeriales seruientes dayes called sergeant qui vita episcopi eam sortiti sunt administrationem retinebunt eandem seorsum domibus grangijs episcopalibus manebunt dum manu regia episcopatus fuerit brolium nec vendere nec donare nec aliquo modo diminuere poterimus si vacauerit sedes messionum tempore custodes grangiarum retinebunt quod sufficiat seminandis agris pascendis conducendis bubulcis pastoribus ministris animalibus caeterum regij iuris est et si vacauerit sedes vindemijs vinum de taxone de tallijs vinagium quod per pagum colligitur caeterique omnis redditus praeter ea quae libertate donauimus similiter regij iuris erit vt autem hoc donum nostrum posterum ratum sit fixum permaneat c actum parisius anno incarnationis domini episcopi sicut antiquae consuetudinis huc vsque tenor habuerat domibus episcopalibus quidquid ligneum aut ferreum siue per no siue per ministeria le nostros de caetero capiamus animalia quoque episcopi caetera omnia quaecunque ad supellectilem domorum episcopalium pertin dignoscuntur sub eadem immunitate concludimus praeter annonam vinum aurum argentum quae omnia iuxta vetustam fecerit qua uis tota terra illa aditu difficilima montuosa episcoporum potestate semper extiterit non tantum ad faciendum ecclesiasticam censuram sed ad iudicandum ingladio super illes quos culpa sua episcopus matisconensis morietur vel quotienscum que sedes matisconensis ecclesiae vacauerit capitulum matisconense nobis licentiam de electione facienda requisierit eidem sine contradictione eligendi licentiam concedemus si vero episcopus eiusdem ecclesiae intestatus decesserit omnia mobilia quae ipse vel per se vel per alium regno nostro possidebat libere integre nostra erunt si vero idem episcopus nostra licentia testamentum fecerit per testimonium bonorum virorum de mobilibus quae ipse vita sua possidebat no contra idem testamentum nequaquam veniemus praeterea sciendum est quod omnia regalia omnes prouentus regalium post mortem episcopi matisconensis quandiu sedes dictum vacauerit vbicunque sint regno nostro quiete pacifice possidebimus no eadem regalia eo statu puncto postquam ad philippus dei gracia francorum rex c nouerint vniuersi praesentes pariter f turi quod cum dilaecta fidelis nostra blanca comitissa campaniae citata esset per ducem urgundiae mathaeum de montemaurencij wilelmum de barris vt cariam nostram veniret iuri paritura de querelis quas erardus de brena philippa que dicitur vxer eius contra eandem comitissam eius filium proponebant super eo quod ipse erardus eadem philippa petebant nobis quod no reciperemus eiusdem erardi h magium de comitatu campaniae sicut come henricus nepos nosteri quem ipsa philipp patrem suum esse dicebat inde saisitus fuerat tandem apud melodunum nostra pr sentia constituti praedicta blanca comitissa campaniae theobaldus filius eius ex parte praedicti erardus de brena philippa ex altera requirentes super hoc fibi fieri iudiciam iudicatum est baronibus nostris videlicet rhemensi archiepiscopo willelmo lingonensi willelmo catalaunensi philippo beluacensi r nouiomensi episcopis odone duce burgundiae paribus regni nostri alijs multis scilicet willelmo com p ti roberto comite drocensi r comite britanniae guidone comite sancti pauli willelmo de upibus senescallo andegaui willelmo comite iouiniaci ioanne comite bellimontis roberto comite de alenconia etiam quibusdam episcopis videlicet antisiodori car otensi syluanectensi lexoniensi nobis audientibus iudicium approbantibus quod hommagium erardi de brena vel dictum philippae de comitatu campaniae nullate u recipere debebamus quamdiu comitissa blanca theobaldus filius eius vellent ius acere curia nostra persequi quod vsus consuetudo franciae talis est quod ex aliquis saisitus est de feudo per dominum feodi dominus feodi non debet alium reci ere hominem de eodem feodo quamdiu ille qui saisitus est de feodo per dominum feo paratus sitius faecere curia domini feodi persequi et quia comitem theobaldum quondam nepotem nostrum patrem istius theobaldi per assensum baronum ostrorum nullo contradicente recipimus hominem de comitatu campaniae briae icut pater eius come henricus tenens fuerat post decessum dicti comitis theobaldi ecipimus blancam comitissam de codem comitatu foeminem nostram sicut de baillio praeterea theobaldum filium eius saluo baillio praeterea theobaldum filium eius luo baillio matris suae nullo contradicente de iure non debemus dissaisire blancam comi issam vel theobaldum filium eius de comitatu campaniae briae quamdiu parati essent u facere curia nostra persequi et ipsa coram nobis alijs baronibus nostris semper obtulit hoc autem iudicium factum fuit nihil amplius quaesierunt de praedicta omitissa eius filio sic sine die innocentio papa eccl siae romanae spondeo polliceor promitto iuro quod omnes possessiones honores iura romanae ecclesiae pro posse meo bona fide protegam ipsam ad ea retinedas fide iuuabo quas autem salomon consequently king spaine king prince earth wee haue meanes passe encreaseth commeth spaine sterrilitie soyle causeth continuall carriage thither france corne wine cloth thing necessary life man king spaine want qualifying stiling themselues king leon arragon nauarre valencia granada toledo murcia cordoua portugall algaraes long thred like title prouinces hath caused haue seene countrey shall measure fertile prouinces monarch lillie prouence languedocke guienne poictu bretaigne normandie champaig bourgongne lyonnois daulphine without making mention prouinces seated midst haue named would make many kingdomes king gouerned themselues according manner spa finde without doubt france latitude longitude excelleth much spaine admirable france antiquity greatnesse serued spacious field noble subiect spanish poet lucane shewhow caesar became lord romane empire caesar became master romane empire meanes wealthy prouinces whereas hath spoken like spaine admireth earnestly extendure preferreth good right kingdom spacious world sparsas per gallica rura cohortes euocat romam motis petit vndique signis deseruere cauo tentoria fixa lemano beginneth suetia watered lake geneua lozana unneth thence mountaines vaulga make separation ands germany france castraque quae vogesi curuam super ardua rupem pugnaces pictis cohibebant lingones armis mountaines extend themselues far germany luxembourgthe great extendure mountaines farre strasbourg thence take deriue sour riuers meuse saoha separating mentz toull verdune bourgongnons langrois lucane tearmeth pugnaces saith delighted weare enameled armes varied diuersity colour martiall saith common people langres cloathed garment smoaky colour called minime bardes vsed weare among druides sic interpofitus vitio contaminat vncto vrbica lingonicus tyrianthi bardocucullus lucane maketh leape saying hi vada liquerunt isarae qui gurgite vasto per tam multa suo famae maioris amnem lapsus ad aequoreas nomen non pertulit vndas spake concerning people sauoy watered riuer isera taketh sourse neere montcenis running rowling thorow auoy taketh largenesse montmelian thwarting granoble roman aulphine mile thence sinketh selfe riuer rhosne rhone arising alpes calleth amnem famae maioris plinie naturall history noteth originall spring riuer rhosne swalloweth looseth selfe isara saona thus galliarum fertilis mu rhodanus fluuius ex alpibus se rapiens per lacum lemanum segnemque deferens rarim nec minus se ipso torrentem isaram isara hath course impetu u rhosne thence againe poet hath another leap rouergne whereof rhodes bishop see ciuitas ruthenorum soluuntur flaui longa statione rutheni rouergas windeth bottome narbonois narbonensis gallia countrey narbone france carcassois watered bathed riuer auda riuer big enough politane city narbonna serignano beziers pleasing de ghtfull citie whereof arose prouerbe si deus terris vellet habitare biterris pleny calleth blitterae mile frnm thence auda looseth self mediterranean sea therefore trebellius maketh mention hunc fore aquitanas posset qui fundere gens quem tremeret forti milite victus atax pliny place formerly alleadged saith flumen atax e pyrene r bre sem permeans lacum c auba commeth riuer gar finis hesperiae promoto milite riuer diuiding narbon laguria varus saith maketh separation gaules italie maner speaketh plinie narbonensis prouincia appellatur par galliarum quae interno mari allu tu braccata ante dictum amne varo ab italia discreta hee must take thus ring time prouince wonne romanes reduced forme prouince otherwise time made part gregory great pope epistle wrote king france childebert second name yongest sonne clouis king france excellent aboue king earth maiestie royall aboue men quanto regia dignitas caeteras antecellit tanto caterarum gentium sentium regnorumque regni perfectio vestri culmen excellit esse regem quia sunt alij non mirum est sed esse catholicum quod alij non merentur hoc fortis est sicut enim magnae lampadis splendor tetrae noctis obscuritate lumints sui claritate fulgescit ita fidei vestrae claritas inter aliarum gentium perfidiam rutilat atque coruscat quidquid caeteri reges se habere gloriantur hoc habetis sed ipsi hac vehementius superantur vobis quoniam principale bonum non habent quod habetis looke much royall dignity surpasseth world much kingdome france excelleth height greatnesse nation kingdomes earth honored magnificent title king matter noueltie neither winneth ranke precedencie honor equall many king prouinces world wherein consisteth iustly excellencie prec dencie king maketh profession catholique faith respect deserueth tearmed mostchristian therein excellencie infallible right certaine precedencie communicable prince earth great soeuer may pretend like brightnesse great burning lampe serueth sunne midday feares cloudie darke night drowned obscuritie manner clearenesse faith mostchristian king france shineth bright splendour glory aboue king clouis generall councell assembled orleans dominis sanctis apostolica sede dignissimis episcopis clodouaeus rex enunciante fama quid actum fuerit vel praeceptum omni exercitui nostro priusquam patriam gothorum ingrederemur beatitudini vestrae praeterire non potui primo quoque de ministerio ecclesiarum omnium praecipimus ne ad subripiendum ea aliquis conaretur neque de sanctimonialib neque de viduis quae religione domini deuotae esse probantur simili conditione de clericis vel filijs supradictorum tam clericorum quam viduarum qui cum illis domo ipsorum consistere videbantur idem de seruis ecclesiarum quos de ecclesijs tractos per episcoporum sacramenta constiterit praeceptum est obseruare vt nullus ex ipsis aliquam violentiam vel damnum patiatur quod ita ad integrum est intelligendum vt ex supradictis si aliquis vim captiuitatis pertulisset siue ecclesia siue extra ecclesiam omnino sine aliqua dilatione praecipiamus esse reddendos de ceteris quidem captiuis laicis qui extra pacem sunt captiuati fuerint approbati catholici aut cui volueritis arbitrij vestri non est denegandum nam de qui pace nostra tam clerici quam laici subrepti fuerint si veraciter agnoscitis vestras epistolas de annullo vestro infra signat sic ad no omnimodis dirigatis parte nostra praeceptionem latam noueritis esse firmandum sic tum populus noster petit vt cuicumque epistolas vestras praestare fueritis dignitati cum sacramento per deum benedictione vestra dicere non tardetis rem istam quae poscitur veram esse quia multorum varietates falsitates inuentae sunt vt comprehendantur sicut cicarella life pope sixtus quintus anno dom occasione canonizationis didaci ab alcala orta est inter legatum regis hispaniarum legatum regis galliae magna contentio dicente hispano hoc actu canonizationis sancti didaci hispani sibi deberi primum locum cum potissimum ad regnum hispaniae pertineret praeterea sibi principales quasdam operationes hoc actu incumbere respondit legatus franciae peractis ijs quae facienda hispano erant aut sacello exiret aut locum inferiorem occuparet hispanus iterum vt saltem francus ille hac vice idque ex gratia grace french courtesie primum locum concederet petijt cui francus se quidem hunc locum illi concessurum hac lege ne quid derogaret iuri praecedendi quod galli habebant quod ab que praeiudicio primo quod habiturus esset pontifex sacello legatus hispanicus qui se inferiorem francico semper ostendens huc nun quam accedere solet praesens adesset locumque inferiorem suo occuparet respondet hispanus se nullo modo id facturum hoc enim facto fateretur se illi cedere dum sic inter se contendunt subrepit paulatim ira incaluit sanguis adeo vt ad armae propemodum ad maximum tumultum ventum fuisset nisi aliorum auctoritas interpo ita esset tandem negotium hoc modo compositum est legatus hispanicus ad sacellum non iret sed cardinalis deca eius munere fungeretur eaque faceret quae fecisset legatus gallicus vero legatus consuetum locum retineret peractis canonisatio cum summa summa quiete modestia peracta est chap xiiii ceremony order haue beene yet still kept obserued sacring crowning king mostchristian comparison parisian graund priour stept holybottle hanging necke attired said holybottle went two said lord hostage launce hand two behinde till came forth church great portall whereof presented foure lord graund priour thanking maiestie well following maintaining good auncient customes hacquency led foure groomes belonging maiestie assisted lord graund priour mount thereon two leading bridle one right side left two waited stirrops guiding conducting decentest manner hereupon knight hostage mounted horse knight supporting canopie state lord hostage riding two bearing banner holybottle manner esquire also bearing banner riding venerable religious brother abbey saint rhemigius attired white aulbes crosse torchlight singing processionally two chauntres cloathed coapes bearing staffe siluer house streetes adorned hanging rich tapistries chiefest religious men went captaine lieutenant ensigne diuers inhabitant du chesne le populeux subiects lord abbot according enioyned doe warning sent lord graund priour armed fashion drummes beating ensignes displayed thus marched canopie behinde attended officer escheuinage belonging rhemigius subiects vassailes lord abbot said religious order armes sent enioyned safer conduct holybottle vntill brought back againe rhemigius according auncient custome lord graund priour accompanied formerly hath bin related arriued great portall church nostre dame de rheimes entred eleuenth king person lewes fift tearmed doe nothing lewes loiterer doe nothing hartlesse loiterer named annalist time obserued reigne comprehended vnder three word ludouicus nihil ecit likewise reigned one yeare deceasing compeigne buried abbey cornille king lewes stammerer emperour iune yeare grace race carlouingians continued two hundred thirtie seuen yeares merouingians reigned france three hundred yeares continuance wit yeare grace meroueus assured conquest side rhine gaules vntill yeare according chronicle lauresheim haue bouchard bishop wirtzbourg folrard priest afterward great almo ner pepin le briefe sent rome pope zacharie haue aduise beene called question proceeding new election king made choice pepin le brief maire pallace france supported burden warres reiecting descendant clouis without vertue voide courage sprightly valiancie zacharie gaue opinion answerable deliberation statesthe pope answer message melius esse illum eligere regem quod quem summa auro texta super vestitur chlamide conchilij muricis sanguine tincta tegitur caligis holosericis calciatur pes eius tularibus superficie leunculos aureos habentibus muniuntur eius vero consoda e qui cum eo militiae suscipiendae munus expectabant vniuersi bysso purpura euantur talibus itaque vt praetaxatum est ornamentis decoratus regius gener quasi flos li ij candens roseo superfusus rubore cum illo suo nobili collactaneo comitatu de secreto thalamus processit publicum adducti sunt equi allata sunt arma distribuuntur singulis pro vt opus erat andegauensi vero adductus est miri decoris equus hispa ensis qui tantae vt aiunt velocitatis erat vt multae aues volando eo tardiores essent nduitur lorica incomparabili quae maculis duplicibus texta nullius lanceae vel aculis cuiuslibet ictibus transforabilis haberetur calciatus est caligis ferreis ex ulis itidem duplicibus compactis calcaribus aureis pes eius astricti sunt clypeus leonculos aureos imaginarios habens collo eius suspenditur imposita est capiti eius cassis multo lapide pretioso relucens quae talis erat temperaturae vt nullius ensis acumine incidi vel falsificari valeret allata est ei hasta fraxinea ferrum pictauense praetendens ad vltimum allata est ei ensis de thesauro regio ab antiquo ibidem fignatus quo fabricando fabrorum superlatiuus galannus multa opera studio desudauit taliter ergo armatus tyro noster commenca de enhorter prier de bien faire son heaume estoit tout dore en sa main tenoit e espec alemagne toute nue vous promets que ie ne veis oncques si bel homme mme il estoit car il apparoissoit par dessus tous le autres depuis le espaules king made stand vpon highway caused people make stand kewise beginning exhort encourage entreated performe est behauiour helmet richly guilded hand held sword allemaigne wholly naked protest vnto neuer beheld goodly man appeared taulenesse aboue rest euen shoulder le mesme historien en parlant de ladite iournee soyez certains que celle iournee le roy fit de plus grand faicts armes que iamais iaye veu faire en toutes le batailles ou fus onques et disoit apres la bataille que si neust este sa personne nous eussions este tous perdus morts celle iournee ie croy qua l heure sa vertu force luy fust doublee par la grace de dieu car il ne se feignoit point de se mettre aux danger peril de la bataille la ou il voyoit s gen en detresse il se venoit frapper parmy pour le secourir tant donnoit de coup espee de masse que le turcs nosoient approcher de luy et compterent vn iour le sire de courtenay messire iean de salonay quils auoient veu que six turcs sestoient addressez au roy celuy iour lauoient pris force par le frei de son cheual lemmenoient mais le vertueux prince voyant le danger ou il estoit seuertua de tout son pouuoir par grand couragefrappa sur le turcs qui le tenoient en maniere que luy seul se deliura de leurs main historian speaking concerning day saith beleeue certaine day king performed fairest action armes euer life time beheld battailes haue seene told battaile one meane creadit himselfe meane king bin person wee bin lost slaine day perswaded euen instant houre hie vertue strength became redoubled meerely grace lewes word anno domini mcclxvii pentecoste praelatis baronibus fere totius regni franciae parisius congregatis ludouicus rex franciae videns filium suum primogenitum philippum iuuenem fortem probissimum atque robertum nepotem suum filium oberti fratris sui attrebatensis comitis quondam apud massorram interfecti eos cum pluribus alijs milites nouos genistellae fecit vbi tanta fuit laetitiae solemnitas quod populus ciuitatis parisiensis ab omni opere vacans solummodo laetitiae exultationi intentus per octo dy amplius ciuitate per totum cortinis pannorum varij coloris ornamentis pretiosis mirabiliter palliata cibisque publicis solemnitatem protenderent thus doth ignorance painter caruers make selfe manifest taking image representation said king saint lewes well highraised embossed flat forme painting haue figurde without order cloake ouer royall mantle whereas indeede hee two order namely starre beneath broomefloure two order held full currencie vntill reigne king auncient order manner making knightsat end whereof cardinall hauing made demand gentle present would knight receiuing answere consent oathe said cardinall followeth ego willelmu hollan si militiae princeps iureiurando profiteor regulae militaris obseruantium il prase domini mei petri ad velum aureum diaconi cardinalis apostolica sedis leg ti per hoc sacrosanctum euangelium quod manu tango whereto cardinall answere haec deuota professio sit peccatorum tuorum vera remissio amen giuen blow cheeke caused guird sword proceeded manner ad honorem dei omnipotentis te militem ordino ac nostro collegio grat accipeo et memento quoniam salicator mundi coram anna pontifice pro te colaphicatus illusus est coram pilato praeside flagellis caesus ac spinis coronatuc coram chlamyde vestitus derisus armes shall haue one thousand two hundred pound pension paid yearely euery one knight shall giue halfe marke siluer euery chapter ordenarily said herauld king armesthe yearely pension allowance paid title vnited crowne france2 shall euer chiefe soeeraigne great maister said order held named first founder thereof great soueraigne maistership haue doe present vnite incorporate crowne france without power meanes seperating either v successor cause consideration soeuer may offered way pretended power coronation3 said king successours dispose order manner whatsoeuer monies thereunto appertaining neither conferre commander although place voide vntill haue first bin sacred receiued coronation vpon day required archbishop rheimes shall represent place office said sacring assembly presence twelue peeres officer crowne therein imployed sweare obseruation keeping statute order according forme hereafter following shall stand obliged doe without power dispensing withall cause whatsoeuer morrow said sacring king shall receiue habit coller order hand gaue consecration assisted therein cardinal prelate commander officer said order purpose summoned thither bound present end haue doe ordaine forme said oath shall transcribed inserted booke sacring oathes king must bound take crowned without time afterward act oath omitted forasmuch alreadie haue grace god receiued said sacring crowning yet intend purpose take oath againe hand archbishop rheimes bishop shall please appoint sted first meeting assembly shall hold order presence prince officer crowne lord also shall called thereto apparance hee altogether distast ion phoenix king bird wonder rld ancient tooke knowledge thereof poetsthe generall opinion phoenix historian naturalist st note ouid fifteenth booke metamorphosis saith vna est quae reparet sequeipsa reseminet ale assyrii phoenica vocant nec fruge nec herbis sed thuris lachrymis succo viuit amomi haec vbi quinque suae compleuit saecuia vitae illicis ramis tremulaeque cacumine palmae vnguibus duro nidum sibi coustruit ore quo simul ac casias nardi lenis arista quassaque cum fulua substrauit cinnama mirha se super imponit finitque odoribus aeuum inde ferunt totidem qui viuere debeat annos corpore de patrio paruum phoenica renasci cum dedit huic aetas vires onerique ferendo est ponderibus nidus ramos leuat arboris altae fertque pius cunasque suas patrium sepulchrum perque leues aura hyperionis vrbe potitus ante fore sacras hyperionis aede reponit one bird euermore doth new selfe beget assyrian foule phoenix name set like bird corne herbes phoenix liueth sweet iuy e frankinsence gum amony life fiue hundred yeares well neere spent gone holmetree palmetree gladly mounteth tallants beake build himselfe nest bestrewing cassia sweet nardus best myrrhe gummes cinamon odour else bridall bed composd purest smelles sits downe vpon nest spice dy father corp men say doth soone arise faire young phoenix must liue many yeares againe sire doth age strength obtaine fit loade heauy nest beareth tree father graue cradlenurse labour pietie flieth ayre bright h perions towne fore hyperion temple gate set burthen downe poet doe vnderstand sunne greeke name hyperion hyperiod greeke name sunne crificed swiftestrunning horse wee haue heretofore declared termed towne city sunnea towne edge egypt anci nt geographer vsually called pelusium nilus emptieth selfe iterranean sea hath beene since day called damieta gypt bankes nile anciently called heliopolis ciuitas solis ore remarkable surprizall king lewes made first oyage ouer sea exactly described iohn lord ioinuille steward f champaigne learned history bird seene city egypt time emperour tibe ius vnder whose raigne phoenix worldat time phoenix seene egypt sauiour redeemer uffered death passion bring v hauen eternall life yeare foundation rome seauen hundred fourescore seauen obserued noble histor rome cornelius tacitus sixt booke annals text well worthy regarded paulo fabio l vitellio cos post tongum saeculorum ambitum auis phoenixcornel tacit annal lib egyptum venit praebuit que materiam doctissimis indigenarum grecorum multa eo miraculo disserendi de quibus congruunt plura ambigua sed cognitu non proniere libet sacrum solo animal ore ac distinctu pennarum ceteris uersum consentiunt qui formam eius definiere de numero annorum varia tra tur tur maxime vulgatum quingentorum spatium sunt qui adseuerent mille quadgentos sexaginta vnum intersticij prioresque alites sesostride primum post fide dominantibus de ptolomaeo qui ex macedonibus tertius regnauit ciuit cui heliopolis nomen aduolauisse multo ceterarum volucrum comitatu nouam faciem rantium sed antiquitas quidem obscura inter ptolomaeum ac tiberium ruinus duce ti quinquaginta anni fluxerunt vnde nonnulli falsum hunc phoenicem neque bum e terris credidere nihilque vsurpauisse ex quae vetus memoria firmauit conf quippe annorum numero vbi mors propinquet suis terris struere nidum eique vi nitalem adfundere ex qua foetum oriri primam adulto curam sepeliendi patris ne id temere sed sublato murhae pondere tentatoque per longum iter vbi par oneri par tui sit subire patrium corpus interque solis aram perferre atque adolere hac incuta fabulosis aucta ceterum adspici aliquando aegypto eam volucrem non ambigitur time paulus fabius lucius vitellius consul passage diuers age bird named phoenix came egypt gaue occasion much matter learned men countrey also grecian discussing many thing concerning miracle whereof finde much amisse set downe particularity agreement others questionably doubtfull yet neuerthelesse deseruing bee knowne bird consecrated sunne varieth forme beake different also feather fowles doe consent haue made description forme proportion concerning multiplicity number yeares variable report vulgar coniecture affirmeth hee liueth fiue hundred yeares whereas doe hold hee liueth one thousand foure hundred threescore one yeare first birdes flew citie called heliopolis great number fowles admiring wondring new kinde shape time sesostris raigne amasis ptolomie third king macedonian gouerning egypt antiquity obscure darke betweene raignes ptolomie tiberius yeares end neere approching buildeth nest countrey throweth therein seed generation young one doth spring arise whose first care prouidence growne ripenes bury old yet rash vnaduisedly taking vp quantity weight stone murha stone diuers colour yet cleare christall bearing purple white spottes making tryall carrying long iourney findeth himselfe able holde beare heauie burthen fit accomplishing iourney taketh vp father body beareth altar sunne hee doth burne sacrifice thing may vncertaine fabulously enlarged concerning sometimes seene egypt doubted plin hist nat lib naturalist plinie tenth booke second chapter naturall history saith ethiopes atque indi discolores maxime inenarrabiles ferunt aues ante omnes nobilem arabia phoenicem haud scio fabulose vnum toto orbe visum magnopere aquile else purple colour yet traine istinguished rosiehewde feather face head thickened plumie e maninilus auouch oldest men liuing haue seene ara sacred sunne liuing sixe hundred threescore re old cassia frankinsencc perfume buildeth hath filled sweete odour hee dieth vpon first bone marrow worme bred soone groweth young iust hee furnishing procreators funeral conueighing whole neere citie sunne panchaya leaueth vpon ar petrus belonius man end tenth booke nature bird keth wonder phoenix french lucretius du bartas hath exactly well translated language forealleadged author haue written fift day weeke le coeleste phoenix commenca son ouurage parle phoenix terrestre ornant dvn tel plumage s membres reuiuants que l annuel flambeau de cairan iusques en fez ne void rien de plus beau il fit briller s yeux il luy planta pour creste vn astre flamboyant au sommet de sa teste il couurit son col dor descarlate son do et sa queue azur puis voulut quatropos luy seruist de venus quvne mort feconde rendist son aage egal au long aage du monde car ayant veu glisser dessous vn ciel diuers et cent fois dix estez cent fois dix hyuers de siecles abatu il luy prend vne enuie de laisser en depost la flamme sa vie de mourir pour renaistre dentrer au tombeau pour apres en sortir cent mille fois plus beau lors perche sur le bra dvne palme il entasse le baume sur le nard dessus la casse et sur le poinct du de leurs branch bastit son vrne son berceau son sepulcre son nid cependant quil attend quvne flammeche esprise lodorant buscher s o sacrez reduise en genitale poudre que ce bois ardans finissent non sa vie ains s caduques an leschanson phrygien dvne prodigue aiguiere ne verse sur le champ riuiere apres riuiere le froidureux trions ne couurent de verglas le bois phoeniciens lautan ne daigne pa passer le bord lybique lantre hyperboree retient dans s prison captif le froid boree car adonc la nature encontre tout effort soigneuse tient la main sa viuante mort s funebres apprests sa naissance s couch mesmes le clair soleil sur son lict douxflairant iette vn de s cheueux qui tout soudain sesprend aux rameaux de sabee peu pen consume de limmortel phoenix la chair la plume presquen mesme moment de ce cendreux monceau naist vn ver puis vn oeuf puis vn autre oyseau aincois le mesme oyseau qui nay de sa semence deux cent lustre nouue aux trespassant recommence au milieu du brasier sa belle ame reprend infiny par sa fin dans la tombo se rend de soymesme se fait par vne mort prospere nourrice nourrisson hoir fils pere mere nous monstrant qu il nous faut de corp auis est india per quingentos annos de ano implet se aromatibus sic nidificat indicat sacerdoti heliopolitano mense menoth siue farmuth implet aram sacerdos sarmentis ibi confert phoenix nata electrum arae imponit et primo solis ortu phoenix quidem mouet pennas vero calore accenditur electrum sit exuruntur aromata ipsa phoenix incen ur crastino die de cinere gignitur vermis secundo pennas adfert tertio ad anti redit naturam sic ad sua loco reuertitur phoenix bird india fiue hundred yeares age loadeth himselfe lybanus aromaticall spice buildeth nest sheweth heliopolitane priest moneth farmeth fa muth priest filleth altar branch thither doth phoe x bring diuers drugges amber sweete spice laying vpon altar first day rising sunne phoenix fluttereth feather ouer e heate warmth sunne kindleth fiereth amber drug ice burne therein phoenix burneth himselfe next morrow shes worme engendered second day hath feather third day recouereth auncient nature returneth wonted place saint ambrose appertient plustost mourir que dy faillir de maintenir lamais lordre du esprit sans iamais le laisser deehoir amoindrir diminuer tant quil serum nostre pouuoir obseruer le statuts ordonnances dudit ordre entierement selon leur forme teneur le faire exactement obseruer par tout ceux qui sont seront cy apres receux audict ordre et par expres ne contrenenir iamais ny dispenser ny essayer de changer ou innouer le statuts irreuocables diceluy ainsy le urons vouons promettons sur la saincte vraye croix le sainct euangile signe henry oath king henry grace god king france nauarre doe sweare vowe solemnely hand god creator liue dye holy faith religion catholique apostolique romaine good mostchristian king appertaineth rather dye faile therein maintaine euer order holy ghost without euer french massiuemaistres reuerends vous fait scauoir vous enuoyeou la scedule conten aucunes assertion auec leurs reprobation parquoy nous vous requer r peine de droict que vous donniez publiquement vostre deliberation par escrit si ce assertion de laquelle est venu notairement scandale est erronnee condamner que nous puisions consequemment proceder si comme ordre de droict le requiert ce que u ayez vous assembler dans le mercredy vingtiesme iour de ce mois de december english reuerend maisters giue know send scedule containing certaine assertion reproofes wherefore require vpon penaltie law hat giue publiquely deliberation writing whether assertion whereof risen notorious scandale erroneous condemned end ay consequently proceede according order law requireth wherfore mble selues betweene wednesday twentieth month december proposition haue formerly obserued quilibet tyrannus potest debet licite meritorie occidi quocumque suo vassallothe damnable proposition subdito per quemcumque modum maxime per insidias per adulationes non stante quocumque iuramento aut confoederatione facta apud eum non expectando sen entiam aut mandatum iudicis cuiuscumque tyrant may ought lawfully meritoriously murdred owne ssaile subiect sort manner whereby intrapped especially cret ambush flattery notwithstanding oath allegeance made onfederacie contracted done without attending sen ence command iudge whatsoeuer sorbonnists met together number fourescore doctor meeting sorbonnists achelers diuinitie threescore one masse holyghost g sung according manner case requisite accustomed thir enth day september yeare one thousand foure hundred thirteene hey condemned execrable proposition censure whereof follow th tenure censure sorbonnists vpon proposition haec assertio generaliter posita secundum acceptionem huius vocabuli tyrannus est error nostra fide doctrina bonorum morum est contra praeceptum dei occides glossa propria auctoritate et contra hoc quod dicit dominus noster mat vicesimo sexto omnes qui gladium acceperint glossa intelligit propria auctori te gladio peribunt item haec assertio vergit subuersionem totius reipublicae vniuscuiusque regis aut incipis item dat viam licentiam apperit ad pura alia mala ad fraudes ad violatio item dat viam licentiam apperit ad plura alia mala ad frudes ad violatio em fidei iuramenti ad proditiones generaliter ad omnem inobedientiam ubiecti ad dominum suum ad omnem infidelitatem diffidentiam vnius ad alterum consequenter ad aeternam damnationem item ille qui affirmat talem errorem obstinate alios qui inde sequuntur est haereti tanquam haereticus debet puniri etiam post suam mortem vt notatur decretis icesimo tertia questione quinta decretorum actum parisius anno millesimo quadringentesimo decimo tertio die mercurij deci tertio volens ad extirpationem errorum haereseon diuersis mundi partibus inualescentium prouidere sicut tenetur ad collecta est nuper accepit quod nonnulle assertiones erroneae fide bonis moribus multipliciter scandalosae totiusque reipublicae statum ordinem subuertere molientes gmatisatae sunt inter quas haec assertio delata est quilibet tyranus potest debet licite meritorie occidi per quemcumque vassa suum vel subditum etiam per clanculares insidias subtiles blanditias vel adu tiones nonobstante quocumque praestito iuramente seu confaederatione facta cum eo non pectata sententia onely withdrew himselfe nouara armie artillerie speedily followed french armie whereto bourgongnon captain named de yottieres yeelded himselfe come forth said towne nouara wherein time lodowicke foure ordenarily good feast would weare goodly greene garland head chronicle telleth v socommandations attributed greene colour chiefly emerauld vertue thereof like manner colour note open heart free courage gladnesse courtesie gentility among stone nature affordeth fruitfull wombe riuers westerne indiaes one fitting correspondent eyesight emerauld make knowne excellencie vertue tarnisheth yea retreate prouince poictois duke bourbon become maister thereof vnneastle english thence driuen vndermine within mine duke himselfe formost armes squire castle hee heard bee called aloud regnauld de montferrand meeting handyblowes sword fiue stroakes one another among hearing blowes could containe themselues cryed bourbon bourbon nostre dame whereat squire regnauld de montferrand became much amazeda souldier one eye mine withdrawing himselfe backward said gentleman lord duke bourbon heere yes truely answered borgne de veausse hee himselfe person hereupon replyed regnauld de montferrand saying bound praise god hath day afforded mee great grace honour meete heere armes prince valiant borgne de veausse tell desire hee would well pleased honourable place hee would make mee knight owne hand neuer haue giuen mee honorably valour honour haue found ready yeeld place heereon borgne conferred duke bourbon well perceiuing matter tended great honour made answer hee well contented doe prouided montferrand bring keyes dore mine whereto montferrand condiscended gaue regnould de montferrand made knight duke bourbon mine vnder ground keyes deliuered euen duke himselfe made knight montferrand requested departure would pleased giue prisoner skirmish dyed marueill wherewith duke bourbon well pleased appointed monferrand surrender vp castle next morning moreour appointed knight squire duke bourbon morrow performe action armes mine castle one another messire iohn de laye marshall kept end man might pleased fighting mine th th bourbon knight squire armes castle lord partenay messire iohn de laye castle montferrand lieutenant bartholomew de montpriuat yet minded returne england summon surrender castlethe castle vertueill duk bourbon hee yeeld vp according hee promised honour haue done vnto made knight hand high valiant prince honour done linage euer hereafter du e regnau de montferrand immediately duke thus answered messire regnauld knighthood worthily bestowed vpon valiant man good descent forthwith duke sent goodly courser readily brought bestowed montferrand afterward caused brought messire guillaume de la pierre chamberlaine great golden girdle weighing tenne markes siluer hee also gaue messire regnault de montferrand returned hearty thankes accounting himselfe highly honoured said hee would neuer arme himselfe serue place duke bourbon returne siege kingdome thu arriuall shippes hauen taken degree afterward low towne belonging port hauen morrow castle yeelded selfe duke gaue guard genewayes thence duke went doe much languillastre another well fortified place sarazen victualled themselues yet likewise giuen charge sarazen afterward sodaine guske winde tempest rough storme duke transported thence army carried ile sicilie messina city appertaining great baron countrey named messire mainfroy lord clermont duke remained eight dayes refresh people prepare shippes due fitting order lord clermont ouer beside messina power also ouer trapes derpanum distant three league messina messana ouer palermo panormus author ty mainfroy lord clermont ente tainment giuen duke beside halfe ile sicily hee much troubled gout hardly could permit himselfe conueyed receiuing welcomming duke hee caused serued houshold attendant defrayed charge eight dayes space long hee continued extraordinary great cheare lord duke himselfe together ord coucy count deu count daulphine dauuergne duke bourbon depart sicilie lord clermont requested hee would pleased make knight valiant prince could whereupon duke finding himselfe highly beholding made knight cathalogna compelled iohn arragon set sonne libertie release prison physition iane henriques stepmother gaue iulepprince charles poysoned iane stepmother whereof dyed within short citie barcellona wednesday three twentieth september yeare one thousand foure hundred threescore one aged fortie yeares three moneths foure twentie dayes reuenge death people rose commotion vnder conduct count de paillars issued house arragon marched ranged battaile besiedged towne citie gironna iane henriques resided ferdinando duke monblanck sonne iohn arragon mediated contract king lewes eleauenth name father charles eight free enioying countie roussillion sold great grandfatherthe countie roussillion obtained king lewes eleauenth haue said promise ouerplus said saile giue pay vnto ready money summe three hundred thousand crownes gold coine france hee aide also two thousand fiue hundred souldiours horsebacke seauen hundred whereof compleate lance may reade word bond made said iohn king arragon king lewes eleauenth couenants contract passed substantially betweene two king pateat vniuersis quod no ioannes dei gratia rex aragonum nauarrae scicilia valentiae maioricarum sardiniae corsicae come barcinonae duce athenarum neopatria ac etiam come ruscinionis ceretaniae attendentes confiderantes vos illustrissimum christianissimum principem ludouicum eadem gratia francarum regem consanguineum confoederatum tanquam fratrem nostrum charissimum dum superioribus diebus celsitudo vestra villa saluatierra comitatus benarui no autems loco sancti pelagit sainct palais capitale de la basse nauarre ou est laudience royale la monnoie regni nostri nauarrae adesset adessemus propter sincerum affectum beneuolentiam praecipuam quam erga no nostrum honorem geritis obtulisse nobis succursum contra inobedientes aduersantes nobis cataloniae principatu hoc videlicet modo quod mitteritis ad no ad eundem cataloniae principatum septingentas lanceas munitas sagittarijs vel alijs gentibusde tractu cum peditatu competenti artillerijs alijs munationibus iuxta formam modum regni vestri franciae vestrisqui proprijs sumptibus expensis seruitio nostro manebunt vsque quod ipsi catalani inobedientes deuenerint red cti fuerint ad nostram veram obedientiam similiter si vobis dicto serenissimo francorum rege habere voluerimus ex dictis gentibus vestris pro seruiendo nobis guerra regnis aragoniae valentiae vel altero corumdem regnorum mittetis nobis quadrigentas lanceas duntaxat munitas modo forma praedictis vestris pariter sumptibus expensis quidquid iustum fore censentes consonum rationi vt pro maximis sumptibus expensis quos quas pro stipendijs dictarum gentium serenitatem vestram agere oportebit condecens per no eadem fiat satisfactio emenda idcires tenore presentis deliberationis ac de nostra certa scientia conuenimus paciscimur vobiscum dicto illustrissimo francorum rege atque promittimus no obligamus celfitudini vestrae performam validam stipulationem quod primo casu quo ad no miseritis ad dictum cataloniae principatum dictas septingentas lanceas munitas sagittarijs vel alijs gentibus de tractu cum peditatu competenti artillerijs alijs munitionibus iuxta formam modum dicti regni vestri franciae vt est dictum nostro seruitio vestris sumptibus expensis manserint vsque quo dicti catalani inobedientes nobis deuenerint reducti fuerint ad nostram veram completam obedientiam dabimus trademus vibis aut cui seu quibus volueritis loco vestri realiter defacto ducentos mille scutos aureos veteres monetae regni vestri praedicti franciae le vieux escuts faisolent soixante quatre au marc le poids de huict onces au marc dalloy vingtquatre carat vn quart de carat de remede vel valorem verum corumdem isto videlicet modo quod soluemus aut solui faciemus vobis aut cuicumque scu quibuscumque vobis legitimam potestatem habentibus centum mille scutos intra vnum annum computandum eo tempore quo dicti catalani inobedientes deuenerunt reducti fuerunt ad nostram veram completam obedientiam alios centum mille scutos veteres vel verum valorem eorumdem soluemus seu solui faciemus vobis aut cui volueritis mandabitis nomine vestro intra tempus alterius anni computandi fine terminus primae solutionis faciendae de dictis prioribus centum mille scutis sicundo autem casu quo ex dictis septingentis lanceis de quibus supra mentio habetur quo ad catalauniae principatum celsitudine vestra habere voluerimus quadringentas lance munitas modo forma praelibatis illas cum effectu mittetis vestris proprijs sumptibus expensis pro seruiendo nobis guerra regnis aragoniae valentiae vel altero eorumdem regnorum ibi quantum opus fuerit permanserint dabimus trademus vobis aut cui seu quibus volueritis mandabitis loco vestri realiter de facto trecentos mille scutos auri veteris monetae dicti vestri regni franciae hunc videlicet modum quod soluemus aut solui faciemus vobis aut cuicumque seu quibuscumque vobis sufficientem potestatem habentibus centum mille scutos infra annum vnum computandum tempore quo dicti catalani inobedientes deuenerint reducti fuerint ad nopram veram completam obedientiam alios centum mille scutos vetere vel eorum valorem soluemus scu solui faciemus vobis aut cui volueritis mandabitis nomine vestro intra tempus alterius anni computandi sine terminus primae solutionis faciendae de dictis prioribus centum mille scutis reliquos autem centum mille scutos ad complementum autorum trecentorum mille scutorum suo casu soluemus seu sol faciemus vobis aut cui voberitis mandabitis nomine vestro intra tempus alterius anni computandi fine ter ini secundae solutionis faciendae de alijs centum mille scutis promittentes vobis dicto serenissimo francerum regi consanguineo confoe derato tanquam fratri nostro charissi que prothonotario notario infrascripto tanquam publicae authenticae persona quorum modo pro omnibus interest aut interesse poterit quomodo libet futurum legit ime stipulanti nostra bona fide verbo regio quod eosdem ducentos mille seutos casu ali trecentos mille utos suo singula singulis referendo soluemus seu solui faciemus dabimus vobis seu cui aut quibus volueritis mandabitis nomine vestro iuxta mode seu formam superius mentionatam atque tandiu terminis supra designatis statutis quibusuis vlterioribus dilationibus subterfugijs ac exceptionibus reseratis penit procul pulsis adeo omnia singula prout per no supra infra promissa oblig sunt tenendum complendum inuiolabiliter obseruandum omni cum effectu obligauim vobis dicto serenissimo francorum regi generaliter omnes redditus introitus iura emolumentae querumlibet regnorum terrarum nostrarum omniaque bona nostra mobilia stabilia quaecumque vbicumque reperientur haebita habenda et specialiter expresse obligamus vobis quoscumque redditus introitus iura emolumenta quae ne habemus si tamen aliquae sui factae gratiae vel assignationes super iuribus redditibus dictorum comitatuum rossilionis ceretaniae vltra ordinari quod decedentibus ill qui ea recipiunt vos dictus illustrissimus francorum rex haheatis recipiatis b bere debeatis cum omni iuris plenitudine integritate videlicet modo quod po quam quantitates praementionatae serenitati vestrae debitae fuerunt quae dicto ordine non fuerint exsolutae modis formis superius memoratis eadem celsitudo vestra intro tus iura emolumenta dictorum comitatuum rossilionis ceretaniae deductis omnibus modo quo supra dictum est habeat recipiat per manus magnifici ac dilecti consili nostri carolus de vlmis militis procuratoris regij eisdem comitatibus rossilionis ceretaniae vel alt rius successoris sui officio supradicto ita quidem quod huiusmodi redditus recipiendi n n computentur sortem principalem dictorum ducentorum mille aut trecentorum mille scutorum singula singulis referendo et nihilominus ad maiorem vberiorem vestri tuitionem securitatem conuenimus paciscimur no obligamus quod faciemus operam dabimus efficacem quod dictus carolus de vlmis idoneam faciet obligationem quod aduenientibus casibus supradictis quibus iura redditus introitus molumenta dictorum comitatuum rossilionis ceretaniae vigore huiusmodi conuenti ni pacti obligationis ad vos pertine unt de illis respondebit sublimitati vesirae vel cui voluerit mandabit iuxta formam superius mentionatam quod quicumque succe suus dicto officio procurateris regij suo loco tempore consimilem obligationem qua fecerit super carolus de vlmis procurator regius qui nunc est dictis comitatibus e ssilionis ceretani e et insuper cupientes vos eundem serenissimum francorum reg super praemissis reddere tutiorum eum hac eadem conuenimus paciscimur no bligamus quod illustris ioannes de aragonia filius noster charissimus administrator perpet u ecclesiae caesaraugustanae nobiles petrus durea frater bernardus vgonis de rupebertino commendator montissoni ordinis sancti ioannis hierosolymitani petrus de peralta f rrarius de lannes iustitia regni aragonum milites consiliarij nostri idoneam fac ent obligationem quod si dictus carolus de vlmis procurator regni aut eius successor eodem officio deficeret solutione reddituum iurium dictorum com tatuum rossilia ceretaniae quandiu quantitas dictorum ducentorum mille scutorum suo casu vobis solu tur ipsi quilibet eorum solidum tenebitur tenebuntur quoad solutionem taxat iur um reddituum dictorum comitatuum rossilionis ceretaniae quae annis singulis deductis omnibus modo praedicto soluenda erunt vobis quousque celsitudini vestra quantitas dictorum ducentorum mille scutorum suo casu trecentorum mille scutoru suo vel valoris ipsorum soluta fuerit cum effectu no eam pro maiori omnibus singulorum supra infra scriptorum fortificatione corroboratione renunciamus quoad que mu iuri canonico ciuili foris constitutionibus vsaticis legibus alijs iuribus auxili iuris vel facti qui quae ad ista nobis prodesse aut vobis dicto illustrissimo francorum regi n cere aut obesse possent quouismodo ratione seu causa qui quae dici scribi agitari valerent etiam fauorem regum principum introductis quorum omnium singulerum testimonium presens publicum instrumentum confici iussimus per protho tarium n strum n tarium publicum infrascriptum quod fuit datum actum palatio archi piscopali ciuitatis caesar augustae die vigesimo tertio mensis madij anno nat u te domini millesimo quadringentesimo sexagesimo secundo regnique nostri nauarrae tregesimo septimo aliorum vero regnorum nostrorum quinto signum ioannis dei gratia regis aragonum nauarrae sciciliae valentiae maioricarum sardini corsicae comitis barcinonae ducis athenarum neopatriae ac etiam comitis rossilionis ceretaniae praedicta concedimus firmamus huicque publico instrumento sigillum nostrum apponi iussimus impendenti testis sunt qui ad praedicta praesentes fuerunt magnifici martinus de lannes baiulus generalis regni aragonum mile ludouicus de sancto angelo iurisperitus fisci aduocatus consiliarij ferdinandus de vaquedano secretarius dicti domini regis aragonum signum mei antonij nogueres serenissimi domini regis aragonum prothonotarij ciusque horitate per vniuersam ipsius ditionem publici notarij qui praedictis vna cum praeno inatis testibus interfui eaque per alium scribi feci clausi signatum supra plicam b ra est sealed red waxe et no ioannes de aragonia filius praelibati serenissimi domini regis aragonum ac dei apostolicae sedis gratia administrator perpetuus ecclesiae caesaraugustanae petrus du ea cubernator regni valentiae frater bernardus hugonis de rupebertino preceptor siue commendator montessoni camerlingi petrus de peralta magister hospitij ferrerius de lannes iustitia regni aragonum praelibati domini regis consiliarij qui praesentes fuimus vterque nostrum solidum conuenimus no obligamus vobis sere issimo ac christianissimo principi domino domino ludouico dei gratia francorum regi praesentia prothonotarij ac notarij infra scripti tanquam publicae authenticae persona recipientis legitime stipulantis quod si praelibatus carolus de vlmis procurator egni comitatibus rossilionis ceretaniae aut eius successor quicumque eodem officio deficient solutione reddituum iurium dictorum comitatuum rosilionis cere iae quandi quantitas dictorum ducentoru mille scutorum suo casu dictorum trecen rum mille scutorum suo singula singulis referendo vobis dicto serenissimo domino francorum regi debitae fuerit maiestati vestrae non soluetur iuxta formam obligationis desuper factam per dictum illustrissimum dominum nostrum regem aragonum no quilibet nostrum ex nostris certis scientijs tenebimur tenebitur serenitati vestrae quo ad solutionem dumtaxat iurium reddituum dictorum comitatuum rossilionis ceretania quae omnia singulis deductis oneribus ontento dictum regis obligatione soluenda erunt maiestati vestrae quousque sibi quantitas dictorum ducentorum mille scutorum su casu trecentorum mille scutorum suo vel valor orum soluta fuerit cum effectu quemadmodum dicto publico instrumento obligationis praedictum dominum nostrum regem aragonum facto dicitur continetur atque omnia singula prout supra dictum est ad no attinet spectat tenendum complendum inuiolabiliter obseruandum no vterque nostrum simul solidum obligamus persona omnia bona nostra vniuscuiuscumque nostrum immobilia habita habenda vbicunque renuntiamus quo ad haec nostris iudicibus ordinarijs localibus iudicio eorumdem submittimus no vtrumque nostrum iurisdictioni coertioni compulsu cuiusuis iudicis ecclesiastici vel secularis coram quo no simul vel diuisim conuenire malueritis nihilominus renunti mu legi iurisperitorum quae dicit quod fideiussor conueniri non potest nisi prius bona principalia discutiantur alicuius iuri canonico ciuili foris constitutionibus vsaticis legibus alijs iuribus auxilio iuris vel facti qui quo quoad haec quae ad no attinent maiestati vestrae nocere aut obesse possent quoram omnium singulorum testimonium presens publicum instrumentum confici volumus ad indemnitatem vestri serenissimi domini regis francorum prothonotarium notarium publicum infra scriptum praesentibus testibus ad ea vocatis rogatis dictis martino de lannes baiulo generali regni aragonum milite ludouico de sancto angelo iurisperito fisci aduocato consiliarijs ferdinando de vaquedano secretario dicti serenissimi domini regis aragonum quod actum fuit dicto palatio archiepiscopali ciuitatis caesaraugustae dicto vicesimo tertio die mensis madij anno natiuitate domini millesimo quadringentesimo sexagesimo secundo signum mei antonij noguerij serenissimi domini regis aragonum prothonotarij eiusque auctoritate per vniuersam ipsius ditionem publici notarij qui praedictis vna cum pranominatis testibus interfui easque per alium scribi feci clusi signatum supra plicam b ita est sealed red waxe king lewes eleauenth satisfied contented obligation would need haue intire enioyment thing obliged said iohn king arragon sold gaue quitted transported said king lewes eleauenth successor king france perpetuitie said countie roussillion cerdaignia euer iurisdiction soueraigntie king lewes eleauenth put reall actuall possession messire tanneguy du castell made gouernor said couties roussill cerdaignia conducter
