hundred fourescore thirteene nineteenth day ianuary betweene king charles ferdinand isabell king arragon castile bare content said ferdinand isabel doe make perpetuall peace king league offensiue defensiue euery prince liuing dyingthe article agreed treatie without excepting said ferdinand isabell shall contract alliance king england archduke austria ferdinand count flanders prince whatsoeuer without expresse consent agreement king named said treatie child ferdinand isabel wit dom michele eldest infant spaine iohn prince asturiesthe two son iohn ferdinand isabel father mother sware treatie holy euangelists laid vpon altar oath thus solemnely sworn said ferdinand isabel likewise son renounced right could haue pretend kingdome naples sort manner whatsoeuer might ensue acquitted gaue granted transported said king charles successor king france al perpetuity conditionally said king charles without counsell prince bloud officer crowne contrary remonstrance court parliament paris many time repeated reiterated acquitted released fiue hundred thousand crownes gold contained bond king iohn arragon hereupon conuenanted ecclesiasticall person prouided benefice liuings diuers place giuen granted put ouer kingconcerning ecclesiasticall benefice liuings said ferdinand arragon held well frenchman natural countrey since king france enioyed land seigneury sold peaceably hold possesse said benefice happen king enioyed freely kingdome naples appertained casereentrie vpon b former concluded couenants king successours king france might reenter proprietie perpignan county roussillion cerdaignia within month said ferdinand successor bin thereto required king successours come crown france thorow defect performing king said successours king france might reenter propriety said britannia quod no trademus ei mariam filiam nostram vxorem quando id poterimus facere de iure secundum consuetudinem ecclesia modo fecimus ea quae facere possumus ei de iure de securitate dicti futuri tagij hoc fecimus ei iurari sicut praedictum est de parte nostra et ipse iurauit nobis quod ipse accipiet eam vxorem cum ipsa ad aetatem debitam peruenerit numquam vita comite dimittet eam aliquo modo actum parisius anno domini milles due tesimo secundo mense aprili indirect dealing king iohn king phil ip augustus vpon bad indirect dealing king iohn england vsed towar inuested himselfe countie bretaigne qui iure haereditario ad c pertinebat affirmed v rigordus adijciens comitatum pictanenfium aneidegauensium quos armorum iure sibi acquireret qua de causa rex artur perpetuo hominem ligium accepit accepta rege licentia mense iulio recessit charter homage inuestiture said arthur count bretaigne county bretaigne aniou maine touraine p ctou copie charter phillippvs dei gratia francorvm rex notum c quod no recipimus arturum comitem britanniae hominem l gium contra omnes qui possunt viuere vel mori nemine dempto de fo dis britanniae andegauiae cenomaniae turoniae quando domino volente vel vel ipse ea acquisiuerimus saluis omnibus teneamentis de quibus no vel homines nostrit nentes eramus eo di quo disfiduciauimus ioannem regem angliae pro interceptionib quas nobis f ceret de hac vltima guerra de qua no obsedimus botauant talus modo qu quando recipiet hommagia de andegauia cenomania atque turonia ipse recipiet hommagia illa saluis conuentionibus inter no ipsum factis ita quod si arturus resilierit conuentionibus inter no ipsum factis ipsi cum feodis suis ad no venient no inn bunt contra ipsum super autem de dominio pictauiae recipimus eundem arturu hominem ligium si dominus dederit quod no vel ipse eam quocumque modo acquis rimu barones vero pictauiae qui imperij nostri sunt alij quos voluerimus facient nobis hommagium ligium contra omnes qui possunt viuere vel mori de terris suis de pracepto nostro facient ei hommagium ligium salua fide nostra si autem charissimus fr r amicus noster rex castellae terra aliquid iuris clamauerit per iudicium curi nostrae definietur si ipsos de assensu vtriusque non poterimus pacificare de normannia vero sic rit quod no id quod acquisiuimus de eo quod dominus nobis concedet quirere ad opus nostrum retinebimus quandiu nobis placuerit hominibus nostris pro nobis terras suas amis runt dabimus id quod nobis placuerit de terra normanniae actum apud gornacum anno domini millesimo ducentesimo secundo men iulio peace two king brokenthis peace andely gournay broken occasion iohn king england refused performe liedge homage county poictiers aniou duchie aquitaine held possessed franc crowne violating oath entred armes soueraigne iohn tearmed well without faith without land hauing got possession nephew arthur person caused strangled prison taken custodie also eleanor eldest daughter geoffrey count bretaigne deceasing paris haue formerly said sister arthur child geoffrey elder brother iohn without land hee closely shut vp strong prison england fearing lea driue forth realme england appertained right father geoffrey england king iohn n hew h arthur whereupon cause king iohn england decree co peeres parliament february one thousand two hundred thirteene attainted conuinced crime high treason death nephew arthur liedgeman king regard county bretaign aniou poictou fiefes held crowne france acquired con fiscated king moreouer leuied great naual army conquest england presumed belong neerest heire lest succeede crowne causae quae philippum regem magnanimum moue ad hoc vt vellet angliam transfretare hae fuerunt vt episcopos qui diu sedi suis eiecti regno suo exulabant suis ecclesijs restitueret vt diuinum seruitium od iam per septennium tota anglia cessauerat faceret renouari et vt ipsum ioan regem qui nepotem suum arturum occiderat poenae condignae subijceret speaketh gordus vnder yeare set lord husband perpetually hee shall suruiue v without heyres descending marriage death descendant hee doe suruiue decease euen owne proper peculiar inheritance wee promise sound faith word queene keepe donation take entire full effect vnder engagement obligation euery part good namely said duchy county seigneurie renounce exception well right fact case appening hee shall take possession time often bretaigne fourth day august yeare ne thousand fiue hundred thirty two haue heretofore spoken somwhat concerning custome bretaigne diuision bretaigne law cal ed assise made feodale succession adiudged aduice state eldest rothers sister kinde grace remained youngest aw duchy bretaigne diuided betweene child duke ount deceased corrected geoffery england count richmond irst husband constance duchesse bretaigne wife may read nouell assise new law assise bretaigne cvm britannia super terris inter fratres diuidendis detrimentum plurimum temere soleat euenire ego gofridus henrici regis filius dux britaniae come riche ntis vtilitati nostrae praeuidere desiderans petitioni episcoporum baronum omnium ritanniae satis faciens communi assensu assisiam feci concessi quod baronijs eodis militum vlterius non fierent diuisiones sed maior natu integrum obtineret inatum minoribus suis prouiderent iuuarent iuxta possessionem ea vero quae unc iuniores possidebant terris siue denariis tenerent quandiu viuerent haeredes uidem terras tenentium possidebunt illas perpetuum denarios autem habentium haeredes post patres non haberent item si terra minorum deuenerit balliuiam fra r maior post eum bailliam habebit quod si fratrem non habue ille amitis bailliam unc cui decedens cum assensu domini sui eam commendabit filiabus vero qui em habebit terram habeat minores maritabit de terra ipsa ad consilium domini propinquorum generis si etiam terra maioris maritagium aliquod accidere con igerit quod iuniori placeat illud habebit nec alii maior conferre potest dum minor velit bere quod si habere noluerit alibi inuenerit maior frater ei de rebus caballis dando perquirat pro posse suo cum consilio propinquorum amicorumque item si minoriterram dederit de qua eum recipiat hominem sine haerede obierit alicui de propinquis suis cui voluerit eam dabit ita quod ad principalem dominum non redibit autem eum non receperit hominem ad maiorem fratrem haereditas reuertet hanc assisiam ego gofridus dux britanniae constantia vxor mea omnes britanniae barones iurauimus tenere decernimus vt necessarium vt maiores natu minores valeant nec amplius terris vel denariis partem habituri sint armes quil vint dont lovis ivveral de vrsins requit audit reigneur de barbasan quil luy donnast con ge en faire ce qui luy fut octroye mais quil trouuast partie laquelle il trouua assez aysement et estoit vn bien gentilhomme anglois angleterre heure fut assignee la uelle il comparurent auoit torch lumiere et combattirent lvn contre l tre vne grosse demieheure ny eut celuy qui ne perdist de son sang de ceux qui auoyent le gardes furent retraicts et ny auoit guere heure au iour la mine de faicts darmes entre le autres raymond de lore qui estoit vn vaillant cuyer entrepri armes deux contre deux prit pour deuxiesme dict et combattirent contre deux angl bien vaillament en euren ne pouuoitonprondre lvn lautre car il auoit vn gros cheuron r de mine haut iusques la poictrine estoit defendu que nul ne passast p r dessus dessous le roy dangleterre le duc de bourgongne firent plusieurs che gran seigneur lesquels vaillamment sestoient portez au faict de armes qui ano ent faicts en la mine et sonnoient trompettes menestriers en leurs seiges fais ieut grand ioye le seigneur de barbasan dict aussi quil en vouloit faire enuoya querir led louis de vrsins gilles descheuiller bailly de chartres le fit cheualiers aussi sonner ce quil auoit de trompettes sonner le cloche de la ville said mine vnderground valiant action e pe formed made knowne man would armes come doe whereupon lewes iuuenall de vrsins requ said lord barbazan would giue leaue make proofe v granted hee must finde partie coape withall worthy gentleman england houre appointed torch light readily prepared fought large halfehour space neither escaped without expence blood till wer guard retreated houre day stout deede armes acted mine among rest raymond de lore valiant esquire vndertooke fight two two accepted second sai lewes de vrsins fought two englishman brauely valiantly honor yet could one take another great spar beame ouerthwart mine reaching high breast prohibited passe either aboue beneath king dead third last habite white damaske signe soules puritie euery knight ought carefull action life behauiour emperour charles fift willed ordained knight said order solemne feast chapter held weare homage liegeman king phillip augustus bois de vincennes moneth ianuarie yeare grace one thousand two hundred eleuen heere may behold tenure ego ferrandus come flandriae et hannoniae notum facio vniuersis ad quos hae presentes litterae peruenerint quod ego sum homo ligius domini mei illustrissimi francorum regis philippi contra omnes homines et foeminas qui possunt viuere et mori et iutaui eidem quod ego faciam ei bonum seruitium et fidele neque ab eo deficiam quandiu mihi voluerit facere rectum curia sua si autem de bono et fideli seruitio ei deficiam volo et concedo quod omnes homines mei tam barones quam milites et omnes commun et communitates villarum et burgorum terrae meae contra sint eidem domino meo reg auxilium et mihi sint innocumentum ad posse suum vsque dum sit domino meo regi emendatum ad gratum suum et volo et praecipio quod praedicti tam barones quam miletes et alij hanc domino meo regi iurent et faciant securitatem si autem aliquis esset qui nollet hoc iurare omne malum quod possem faciam ei nec pacem nec treugam cum illo nunquam haberem nisi per voluntatem et beneplacitum domini mei regis esset quod vt non possit obl uione deleri et vt praed cta perpetuam obtineant firmitatem et securitatem praesentes litteras sigilli nostri munimine et testimonio corroborari fecemus actum vincennis domini millesimo ducentesimo vndecimo nse ianuarij die quinta register immediately tooke hat spake chancellour wordsthe h wordes lord chancellour lord god giue good day speaking word humbled head low lord chancellour without vsing action courtesie vttering one word lord archduke began bow shewing apparance falling knee lord chancellour would suffer raising vp hand held vsed word good sufficient wee pleased lord chancellour proceeded manner holding still archduke hand betweene ownethe chancel arch duke bare headed ring alwayes knee ground shall continue man soueraigne lord bearing faith liege hommage regard peeredome county flanders also county artois charolois others land hold king crowne shall promise serue till death inclusiuely liue dye without reseruing procure good preuent harme acquit c selfe towards soueraigne lord king whereunto archduke answered faith promise die spoken chancellour vsed word receiue king right reserued thing archduke homage others concerning holding forth checke lord chancellour kissed afterward archduke demanded representation person guy de rochefort chancellours court sie archduke humble seruant alwayes ready doe seruice king soueraigne lord maister whatsoeuer shall please command lord archduke thanked petra plures alij magnate de regno franciae vnanimiter conuenerunt assensu publico firmauerunt vt primo die maij posterum ita sit de feodalibus tenementes quidquid tenetur de domino ligio vel alio modo si contigerit per successionem haeredum vel quoquo alio modo diuisionem inde fieri quoquomodo fiat omnes qui de illo feudo tenebunt de domino feodi principaliter nullo medio tenebunt sicut vnus antea tenebat priusquam diuisio facta esset et quandocumque contigerit pro illo totali feodo seruitium domino fieri quis libet corum secundum quod de feodo tenebit seruitium tenebit exhibere illi domino deseruire reddere racaptum omnem iustitiam quidquid antem autea factum est et vsitatum vsque ad primum diem maij maneat sicut est factum sed de cetero fiat sicut est supradictum quod ne possit prophet merlin round table verse french merlin iadis de son art pratique moult bien vsant selon lancien aage edifia pur chef doeuure authentique la table ronde en triomphant ouurage et se monstrast expert si sage en son scauoir que son oeuure hautaine sans vice aucun estoit perfaicte pleine dhonneur exquis royale ornature car de beaute estoit resplendissante et de ouuriers dicte en iudicature la table ronde en honneur triomphante ii la table estoit dvn ouurage mystique bien prattique dexcellent aduentage par cheualiers en estat magnifique la sit garder preseruer doutrage qui tous esto ent remplis de grand courage bien reclamez en ceste basse plaine en la gardant souffrirent maintes peines pour lapprouuer par raison droicture sur tout ouurage estre la plus plaisante et demourer sans quelque forfaicture la table ronde en honneur triomphante iii vn seige estoit en ceste table antique bien ordonne doeuure de haut parage que mesdisans ent iuge fantastique plus dangereux que tempeste ou orage mais tels menteurs pleins de mauuais langage furent confus car la place tant saine promise estoit par la cour souueraine galaad sur toute creature c verse thus englished merlin long since chronicler yeare eight hundred ninearmes giuen charlemaigne king ardulphe postquam ardulphus rex nordumbrorum reductus est regnum suum et legati imperatoris atque pontificis reuersi sunt c armes giuen without vnderstanding reason party caused duke austriaes tent ensigne puld downe hurld vpon heape ditch mire duke made complaint richard haue reparation offence payed derision whereupon duke seeing despised desired god doe reason would remit iniurie richard done wonderfull deedes holyland aduertised brother iohn without land first occasion quarrell sought possesse himselfe kingdome england made resolue returning home sea queene berengaria nauarre wife ioan sicilie sister continued seauen weekes together suffering infinite misery lastly cast coast barbarie whence within space three dayes might haue bin marseilleis fearing count gilles prouince dealte hollowlie holylandking richard returne thorow germanie determined shape course thorow germanie thence passe england without aduenturing lord satisfied answere made stay innes richard saued himselfe prosperous wind one named guillannie de l estang boy vnderstood germaine tongue trauayling three dayes night without receiuing sustenance ante dy tos exiuit qui ibidem intrauit de quo aristoteles libro quinto bonum est mactare pa em triballis alibi sunt loca sunt gens quibus est mactare parentes englishman whole yearea pretty history concerning finding king richard minstrell without hearing tydings heir king place kept prisoner trained vp court ri er minstrill called blondell de nesle saith manuscript old poesy nd auncient manuscript french chronicle long without sight ord life seemed wearisome became much confounded ncholly knowne came backe holy land none could ell countrey arriued whereupon blondel resoluing make search many country would heare newes expence f diuers dayes trauaile came towne good hap neere castell maister king richard kept host demanded castell appertained host told belonged duke austria enquired whether prisoner therein detained alwayes e made secret questioning wheresoeuer came hoste gaue answer one onely prisoner knew yet bin etained space yeare blondel heard wrought ch meanes became acquainted castell minstrel doe sily win acquaintance see king could neither vnderstad h one day sat directly window castell blondel singeth french song made lord himselfe king chard kept prisoner began sing song french king richard blondel sometime composed together king richard heard song knew blondel sung blondel paused halfe song ng entreated sing rest thus blondel knowledge king maister returning home england made baron countrie acquainted king otho frisinghensis reporteth pope leo ruling church excomm nicated said leopold pope offended hand vsage pilgrim detaining king richard like imprisoning pilgrimes returning holyland greatly wronged voyage intermitted impeached great preiudice hinderance latines east emperour henry preuailed money get power king england kept vnder sure guard strongly giued fettered citie wormes emperor remained made coposition said prince ransome raising therby great sum monie mathew paris speaketh nothing fulmination onely saith pursuite dilligence hugh abbot cluny wi chancellour england emperour held diet germanie whereat assembled bishop duke count empire whether brought king richard imputation laid pon king richard emperour die charged many infamous action first counsel meanes lost kingdome apug sicilie belonged hereditary right death king william recouery whereof spent vnspeakable sum monie brought puissant armie thither none effect wherein king richard promised h assistance faithfully mediate tancred restore said kingdomes concerning kingdome cyprus pride brauery pre med thereon appertained kinsman allie vniustly without grounded reason despoiled put prison rigorously inuading h treasure realme selling stranger prince death valiant marquesse montferrat heire said emperor traiterously pursued wrought arsacides inhumanely murdered like occasion sent arsacides massacre king france soueraigne lo phillip augustus insigne trechery oath homage sworne vnto act ouerweening pride rashnesse wrong prince went holyland mathew paris hrough whole course historie layeth stumblingblockes way strange reader vnderstanding auncient vocable saxon nation apud anglosaxones legibus ritibusque suis honores impertiebantur vt quiuis e populo prudentia sagacitate diuitijsque anteibat come thaynus subthaynus que colenus si colenus ita rem auxisset vt habuerit quinque hydas propriae terrae aedem sacram coquinam campanile portam locum autem peculiare munus aula regia tunc erat deinceps habitus par dignitate thayno si thaynus ita prouectus erat vt regi seruierit nuncius eius esset equitauerit um familia si tunc etiam thaynum sibi famulantem habuerit qui ad regiam expedi ionem quinque hydas habuerit eique regia aula domino serui erit terque eius nun ius ad regem venerit hic deinceps data fidelitate domini personam sustinere poterit si pu fuisset quod si thaynus ille ita prouectus erat vt come euaserit pari erat deinceps comite dignitate si mercator ita rem fecisset vt ter vastum mare sua peritia traiecerit pari tunc erat dignitate thayno quod si literarum studiosus talem literis progressum fecisset vt ordines habuerit christo militauerit erat deinde venerandus immunis nisi ita excidisset vt suo mu ere vti non potuiss leaue recherches antiquity learned come militarie order scotland militarie order scotland historian nation doe ordinarily call order saint andrew order knight sent king iames fift leslaeus memorie whereof king alphonso leon ninth sirnamed noble gaue title nobilitie heardsman martin also sirnamed cabeza de vaca cowes head armes eschicquette de gueulles dor de sept piece la bordure dazur chargee de six testis de vaches dargent store land likewise giuen baesa iaen descended knight renowned valiancie history spaine namely dom fernand ruyz cabeza de vaca knight high courage aduentures performed action admiration succour gaue king castile dom ferdinand called sainct surprizall conquest cordoua wonne moore spaine yeare one thousand two hundred thirtie sixe foure twenty yeares battaile tolosa order saint iames tearmed sword chap v briefe historie prince pelagius race genealogie descending pelagius neere kinsman last king gothes dom roderigo drowned guadaleta battaile wonne moore xeres de medina sidonia saint martin day nouember yeare grace seauen hundred foureteene de caesar augustus seauen hundred fiftie two saued himselfe better fortune mountaines astures lying close secretly sometime auoided first furie ammirant musa also captaine tariffa conqueror spaine remained naturall inhabitant astures compelled law warre obey victorious arabes liue vnder controle pelagius wise worthy prince seeketh fauour mugnusa vpon condition would prescribe vanquished pelagius ingenious prince sought winne amitie mugnusa naturally spanyard made renegado became gouernour gigion astures captaine tariffa mugnusa well liking seruices pelagius made imployment charge belonging prouince space fiue whole yeares end whereof sent tariffa remained cardona corduba absence pelagius world attributing onely honour christophere columbo gonouese first discouerer new world due auncient french captaines whose memory hee might easily possesse himselfe cardes nauigations much tardied neglected miserable estate condition france vnder long reigne king charles sixt yet notwithstanding glory giuen christopher columbus spaniard cal christouall colon primer conquistador de el nueuo mondo de la india whose ligne descended duke veragua il portoit lescu en manteau le primier de gueules au costeau dor armes columbus et lautre dargent au lyon rempant de gueules poincted argent vnde dazur cinq isle dor vn monde de mesme et pour de iz ceste legende lentour castilla leon mundo nueuo dio colon thereby declare new worlde discouered vnder reigne charge isabella queene castille leon high deseruing tongue scandale disgrace could way blast reputation selfe minde hath beene time vnder first iudges knowne certaintie armes frequent e yea armes easie take name countrey without inuention counte formerly alleadged saiththe seale appertaining councell castille el origen de toma castillo por armas fue por allusion del mismo reyno de castilla thereupon produceth figure auncient comenco en el anno de en tiempo del rey sancho de cast lla tomando nombre del castillo de calatraua el qual siendo de la orde de los templarios hallandose poderosos para defender lo contra la fuerca de los more lo dieron al rey sancho ofreciendose raymundo natural de burueua abad del monasterio de sanctum maria de fitero que e el yno de nau arra de la oren e cislel frey diego velasquez de la misma orden que te auia sido gran cauallers en armas otros caualleros hermanos desta orden su defensa el rey se la dio yde aqui tvvo principio esta orden caualleria cuia insignia e la cruz rox floreteada que tomaron por deuisa en los pechos imitacion de los cauelleros france de la sanctum cruzada que por estos tiempos passau n la guerra de vltra mar armas sen la misma cruz en campo de oro los lados della do trauas azules por alusion del castillo de calatraua de donde tuuo su principio authour hath made spanishe thus englished order calatraua tooke beginning yeare one thousand one entertained receiued order band yet must haue followed court space ten year fought three time least moore haue set downe rule obseruations knight order receiued colling embracing sworne keepe inuiolably article constitution knight band knight band stood obliged speake king defence countrey good commonwealth must speake king nothing pure truth without lying terie must reueale whatsoeuer hath heard spoken either person state knight conuicted lying shall walke moneths space without wearing sword keepe companie martiall men souldiers aduanced charge dignity owne qualitie mechanicall artizans men base vile condition must keepe faith promise inuiolably men estate qualitie soeuer must prouided armes horse well appointed vnder paine loosing title knighthood perill standeth seene mounted mule without band sword make complaint wound receiued war neither vaunt valour manhood make account mockt scorned railed body haue carriage discreete graue wholly measured leuell honestie vse gaming card dice must pawne engage habit armes horse must courteous towards lady gentlewoman shall performe honor seruice vttermost power quarrell happen another knight band standeth bound commit arbitrement knight band shall appointed thereto knight vsurpeth weare band without hauing receiued king hand shall stand engaged defend himselfe two knight order band happen haue victorie may lawfully keep maintaine vanquished shall banished court euery strange knight winneth prize either iousts tourneyes action armes knight band shall receiued admitted order knight band setteth hand sword another knight order shall banished court two moneths space time two moneths shall weare halfe band wound companion shall remaine imprisoned halfe yeare banished count another halfe yeare king onely iudge knight band knight band stand obliged accompany king time shall goe warres knight said order shall weare band march wa moore onely seruice shall required else abstaine wearing knight band meete together three seuerall time yeare may speake king thing necessarily con rne order bee appointed king shall bee ell mounted armed assembly meeting bee onthes aprill september christmasse exercise iousts ioco de canna pike also mannage or dayes ordained knight shall remaine court without seruing lady gent woman enioy marriage otherwise honor knight band bound present tourneyes shall e performed mortesa di de valencia pope clement fift name religion knight templers wholly abolished defaced throughout christendome cause shall declare come speake concerning order east two yeares knight saint iohn ierusalem christian driuen palestine expelled order christian palestine enstalled possession goodly isle rhodes bull granted said pope clement fift templers thus wholly exterminated arragon vnder reigne dom iames king arragon second namethe institution order instituted new order knight called lady montesa yeare one thousand three hundred seauenteene montesa kingdome valencia statute order amico nostro philippo illustri rege francorum duximus ineundam hunc modum quod no eidem adiutores erimus nominatim contra ricardum regem angliae comiten othonem nepotem ipsius baulduinum comitem flandriae hayulfum archiepiscopum coloniae contra omnes alios inimicos eius vbicunque cum honore nostro id facere poterimus bona fide sine malo ingenio quando locum tempus id faciendi habebimus si aliquis de imperio nostro eidem philippo regi francorum malum vel ipsius regno si ille qui deliquisset non emendaret hoc per no vel per nuntios nostros per pacem vel per rectum marchia competenti infra quadraginta dy postquam id sciuerimus per pradictum regem francorum si fuerimus citra monte vel episcopus metensis hoc sciuerit si fuerimus vltra monte dominus rex francorum poterit se vindicare de eo sine interruptione no innabimus eum bona fide no non retinebimus imperio nostro aliquem h munem de regno franciae siue clericum siue laicum contra voluntatem charissimi nostri praedicti regis franciae praedictus rex franciae quandocunque voluerit poterit se vindicare de comite flandriae de terra quam idem come habet imperio tam feod quam dominio hoc sine interceptione no bona fide promittimus quod si scirem quod aliquis quaeret malum philippi regis francorum illustris vel eius regno no bona fide id disturbaremus si non possemus disturbare id nuntiaremus eidem regi et quando domino violente coronati fuerimus imperatorem conuentiones eidem ill stri regi francorum renouabimus sigillo nostro confirmabimus no autem manu ne el ni venerabilis suessionensis episcopi fiduciauimus quod omnia praedicta bona fide obseruabimus id etiam de mandato nostro dilecti principis nostri conratus vuirteburgensis b mettensis chiethelmus constantiensis episcopi theodoricus quoque de greuch archduke austria king spayne first name first booke wri ten memory ie ne puis passer par raison que ie ne deuise aucune chose pour quoy le armes de si noble seigneurie sont en deux manieres differentes le vnes de autres car le anciennes ieues armes austriche sont se blasonnent dazur cinq alouettes dor le nouelies que lon dici le armes de la neufue austriche se blasonnent de gueules vne face dargent cannot reasonably let passe regard doe deuise thing armes noble sei neurie two manner different one ancient old armes austria emblazen themselues dazur cinque allonettes dor new said proceedeth afterward saying que le chrestiens mal menez de mescreans ce iaspar fut propos secouru par son frere sne younger frederic lequ l auoit vne blanche parure sur son harnois hee would haue said white coate armes pour estre cognu entre s hommes p rt dextre vn grand volet de blanche soye hee would say scarfe parce tr tou e le bannieres de son seigneur frere le siennes abbattues perdues il prit le volet blanc en sa n plongea ledit vol au sang morts tellement quil fut tout teinct en r uge couleur excepte le milieu du volet qu il tenoit dans samam qui demeura blanc de ce fit vne nouelle banniere e ria austriche seruitour de iesu christ se ferit si merueilleusement de tel courage parmy le sarrasins tant en occit abbatit mesha igna la bonne suite quileut quil redressa la battaille fur nt sarrasins sconfi fut le bon frederic tellement blesse naure sur son corp en diuerses party que la blanche parure dont s armes furent couuertes dont ay deuant touche fut toute teinte rougie de son sang excepte que ce qui estoit sou la nture de son espee demeura blanc comme le blanc demeura en la peignee du volet fit face parmy le vermeil sang du noble prince pour la deffence de nostre foy et la bataille gagnec par le vaillant frederic il fut si bien pense medecine secouru de s blessures quen bref temp il fut guary pour memoire de la victoire ledit frederic par le c nseil de noblesse changea de la en auant le secondes armes telles que ie le ay declarees ydessus christian badly dealt withall miscreant iasper con niently assisted meaner brother would hau said younger white eeking ornament hic eligens sepeliri anno domini millesimo trecente simo octuagesimo octauo kalend martij anima requiescat pace amen person voladislaus ended ligne piastus held crowne poland space fiue hundred fifty yeares better vnderstanding hard aduentures miserable prince reading bull dispensation giue best intelligence copie bull dispensation granted pope clement prince voladislaus clemens episcopvs servvs servorvm dei dilecto v r vol st quondam casi ri ducis cuyauiensis nato militi voladi aesis salutem apostolicam benedictionem sedes apostolica pia mater ani utem desideranter affectans personis sibi deuotis generosi sanguinis claritate ful benignitatis gratiam imp rtitur illis praesertim per quas salus hu ri ter creditur prouentura sane petitio pro parte tua nobis nuper exhi c ntine quod regite poloniae de antiqua approbata hactenus pacifice ob ruata con tu dine est obtentum quod aliqua mulier non succedit eo idque fuit ibidem cifice ob ruatum tempore cuius contrarij memoria non existit quodque tu clarae casim ro regi poloniae tertio consanguinitatis gradu per lineam masculinam coniun proxim r masculus per huius odi existebas quod idem rex qui nullum super tem filium sed fili tantum habebat attendens quod sibi propterea dicto regno deberes succedere dicteque filiae excluderentur ab illo coepit te persequi odio capitali eq e du bus ducatibus quos eodem regno pacifice possidebas nequiter spoliauit totque in vita tuae posuit quod te oportuit de partibus illis recedere et cum alemania te non reputares securum ad regnum franciae transiuisti quia non habebas vnde posse secundum priorem statum tuum viuere decreuisti quod velut conuersus monasterio cisterciensi cabillonensis diccaesis habitares sed abbas dicti monasterij qui tun erat recipere te nolebat nisi promitteres quod cisterciensi ordine perpetuo remaneres quamuis regularis ordinis totaliter inexpertus existeres tamen repente regularem professionem eo secisti post medium autem annum vel circiter cum ipsius rdinis asperitatem pati non posse ad monasterium sancti benigni de diuione ordinis sancti benedicti lingonensis diocaesis de licentia praedicti abbatis accedens eo tanquam c nuersus per annos aliquos moram traxisti tandem vero praedicto casimiro rege sublat de medio cum dictum regnum tibi legitime deberetur ac ipsius habitatores incole te affectarent corum regem habere lodouicus rex hungariae regnum ipsum contra iustitiam occupasset guerram sibi mouisti sed demum dubitans eius potentiam quod te interfici faceret metu mortis necessitate cogente de consilio aliquorum parentum amicorum tuorum ad dictum monasterium sancti benigni redijsti ibidem per aliquos annos vt conuersus remansisti nulla inibi per te regulari professune emissa qvare pro parte tua nobis fuit humiliter supplicatum vt cum nunquam firmum propositum habueris aliquo regulari ordine remanere ac praefati habitateres incolae te eorum regem habere desiderent si quantum indiges quacumque regulari obseruantia te absoluere tibique concedere quod comitatus ducatus quaecumque alia temperalia dominia ac ipsum regnum obtinere regere valeas de binignitate apostilica dignaremur no igitur attendentes sincerae deuotionis affectum quo no romanam ecclesiam reuereris ac sperantes quod illius per quem reges regnant principe dominantur tibi suffragante clementia predictos habitatores incolas qui lod uico praedicto fauentes contra no romanam ecclesiam schismatis damnunt damnabiliter sunt collapsi ad viam salutis iustitiae reuocabis ac considerantes quod olim pr fatus lodouicus foelicis recordationis gregorio papa vnaecimo praedecessori nostro super ho humiliter supplicauit praemissis aliis rationabili u causis ti huiusmodi tuis hac parte supplicationibus inclinati te quacumque regulari obseruantia ad quam ex professione praedicta aut mora quam pr fatis nasterijs vt praemittitur fecisse dignosceris quomodolibet adstrictus existis ex apostolicae potestati plenitudine per praesentes absoluimus tibi nihilominus concedentes quod comitatus ducatus quaecumque alia temporalia dominia quae ex successione vel alias iusto titulo te pertinent pertinebunt posterum ac regnum ipsum si tibi legitime debeatur recipere obtinere regere ac etiam gubernare perinde libere liciter valeas ac dicto cisterciensi ordine professionem regularem minime emisisses nullamque e monasterijs vel eorum altero moram traxisses constitutionibus apostolicis nec non statutis consuetudinibus monasteriorum ordinum praedictorum iuramento cenfirmatione apostolica vel quacumque firmitate alia roboratis cont arijs non obstantibus quibuscumque nulli ergo omnino hominum liceat hanc paginam nostrae absoluti ni concessionis infringere vel ei ausu temeraria contraire si quis autem hoc attentare pr sumpserit indignationem omnipotentis dei beatorum petri pauli apostolerum eius se nouerit incursurum datvm avenioni decimo sepimo kalenda octobris pontificatus nostri anno quarto c c c c crescentius n gilbertin n behold sancti benedicti lingenens diocaesis salutem apostolicam benedictionem cum pro nonnullis nostris romanae ecclesiae negotijs tua presentia sit nobis plurimum oportuna presentium tibi tenore mauda u quatinus receptis praesentibus ad praesentiam nostram personaliter te trasferre procures etiam si delectus filius abbas monasterij sancti benigni de diuione ordinis sancti benedicti lingonensis stake yet tooke part emperour concerning part marquesse palatine outward apparance could beare body subsistance potent part emperor put ballance compromising merit cause indeede good right hath neede good helpe wherefore prince made recourse crown francesuccor fought king france chiefe potent redoubted monarch christendome henry bourbon fourth name king france nauarre meere respect authority might chiefe article league betweene king france first canton switzers qve toutes inimitiez dissentions guerres differends generaux demeureroient esteints assoppis quant aux particuliers quin ont ten de commun auecques le affaire e la guerre quils seroient composez terminez lamiable par gen ce deputez par sa maieste tres chrestienne de confederez que u prisonniers en quelque lieu quils sussent decenus seroient mi promptement en ute liberte sans payer aucune ranson que si quelques gendarme suysses ont procez contre sa maieste non cause de guerre urront pour suiure plaider contre icelle pour en auoir raison que ceux qui apres lalliance renouuellee auec le f u roy lovis xii le canton nt alliez auec ux ont este receuz au nombre de leurs bourgeois seront compris en ce traicte pour ouir du benefice diceluy exceptez ceux qui sont hors de limites de suysses ne arlent point alemand ne sont sujects ausdits canton que tous le priuileges franchise libertez octroyez par le roys de france s pre ecesseurs aux marchands sujects de suysse demeureront confirmez fin que le suysses se sentent de la b enveillance liberalite du roy quil leur fera eliurer vne somme dargent raisonnable de pension pour le frais du siege de dijon oyage ditalie fin que la paix soit fermement entretenue de part dautre que lamitie encom encee demeure perpetuelle sil sesmeut different lvn ny lautre party ne prendra le armes fin de pour su ure son droict par icelles ains suiuant le formulaire susmentionne demandera raison en iustice le vns ne donneront passage ne logis aux ennemis de autres ne souffriront que ur suiects aillent en guerre pour le prince republiques ennemies de france ou de sursse que ceux qui feront le contraire seront rappellez au pais chastiez selon leurs demerites tous marchands pelerins suiects francois suysses pourront traffiquer voyager ller venir librement en france en suysse sans estre outragez ny greuez de nou eaux subsides peages que le roy donnera tous le an chaque canton la somme de deux mille liures tour autant aux valaisans aux gris n ce que leur auoit accorde le roy lovis xii auec la somme de vingt mille liures tournois labbe de sainct gal s suiects ceux de tokkembourg la somme de six cent liures tournois ala ville de sainct gal quatre cent mulhouse quatre cent ceuz de la comte de gruyere six cent liures tournois que le anciens priuileges dont le habitans de bellizone lugano lucarne de la val madie auoient iouy iusques alors au duche de milan seroient continuez confirmez de nouueau que le roy donne le choix aux suysses de declarer dans vn sils aiment mie x nir le pais chasteaux de lugano locarne le valmadie ou bien le l quitter la somme de trente mille escus dor sol et sils prennent ladite somme le gris ceux de la valteline de la comte de clauenne auront leur part ceste somme aut que l vn desdicts canton et moyennant ce bonne paix alliance amitie demeurera perpetuelle inniolable entre le royaume de france le canton demeureront compris en icelle de la part de se maieste treschrestienne nostre sainct pere le pape leon dixiesme le sainct siege lempire romain le roys despagne dangleterre descosse de nauarre de dannemark le ducs de lorraine de sauoye de gueldres le duc republique de venise laure de medici la maison de medici la republique de florence leuesque du liege autres s alliez confederez et de la part de canton le pape leon le sainct siege lempire lempereur la maison daustriche le ducs de sauoye de vuittemberg la famille laurens de medici la republique de florence le mareschal de bourgongne le anciennes alliance remaine quenched smothered concerning perticuler haue nothing comm affaire warre shall bee compounded termined loouingly person thereto appointed moste christian maiestie likewise confederate prisoner saint andrewes day moneth nouember one thousand fiue hundred sixteene alliance renewed king france yeare one thousand fiue hundred twenty one second agreement passed lucerne wherby canton zurich excepted confederate vnited maiestie concluded que si quelquvn tel quil soit fait la guerre dans le royaume de france duche de milan ou autre pais appartenant la c ronne de france deca dela le monts sa maieste pourra faire vne leuee de suysses selon quand bon luy semblera scauoir six mille pour le moins seize mille pour le plus si non que le seigneur de ligues le permettent pourra choisir de tous le canton confederez tels colonel capitaines que bon luy semblera pourueu quils soient gen de bonne renommee le seigneur de ligues ne donneront aucun empeschement ausdits colonel capitaines soldats ne dilayeront ne mettront rien en aduant pour retarder leur acheminement ains dedans dix iours apres la premiere iournee que le roy aura requis secours leur serum permis de marcher demeureront au seruice du roy iusques la fin de la guerre si bon luy semble sans quils puissent estre r appellez par leurs seigneur le roy aussi leur payera tous le gage accaustumez et neantmoins ca aduenant que la guerre fust en suysse que pour ceste raison le canton ne peussent secourir le roy en ce ca il seront quittes de leur promesse pourront soudainement contremander leurs gen ausquels le roy serum tenu donner conge si le roy veut faire guerre s ennemis il pourra faire la mesme leuce de six mille suysses pour le moins de seize mille pour le plus choisissant de colonel capitaines gen de bien de bonne renommee qui seront suysses ou de leurs alliez le roy ne pourra partir l armee de suysses ne la mettre par trouppes deuisees en garuison en diuersees place ne sen seruira sur mer ains sur terre pour la solde de la gendarmerie est accorde que le roy payera par mois chaque soldat saysse quatre florin demy du rhin que leurs gage commenceront au iour quils sortiront de leurs maisons alors leur serum deu la paye de trois mois encore que le roy ne se serue si longuemente deux auant que sortir du pais de suysse il toucheront la paye du premier mois le reste pour le deux autres mois en lieux propres selon quils en aur nt besoin si apres le trois mois passez le roy veut retenir le suysses il leur payera la mesme solde tous le mois iusques au temp quils se pourront commodeement retirer en leurs maisons le colonel capitaines enseignes ambassadeurs autres ayants charge e trouppes seront payez en la maniere accoustumee selon que le predecesseurs roys de france ont faict parcydeuant si quelquvn faict la guerre aux suysses le roy serum tenu de le secourir s despe leur enuoyer deux cent hommes darmes douze piece dartillerie auec leur eq ipage affuts hault le pied scauoir six piece de batterie six canon fournira uantage aux suysses de trois mois en trois mois en la ville de lyon certaine somme de denier pour le fraiz de la guerre si le suysses layment mieux au lieu de deux cent hommes darmes le roy leur donnera tous le trois mois la somme de deux mille escus sil aduient que par le moyen de la guerre esmeue ca ou la le suysses ne peuuent rec urer du sel il en pourront acheter en france le fair emmener en l ur pais si lvne de deux party faict guerre contre s ennemis elle ne fera paix que lautre ny soit comprise serum en la liberte de lautre dy consentir ou non si elle refuse la paix non obstant ce pourra poursuiure la negociation dicelle lvne de party ne pourra receuoir en sa protection ny donner bourgeoisie aux sujects de lautre ny loger secourir ou deffendre le bannis ou ennemis de lautre ains suiuant l article de paix le chassera empeschera sa majeste voulant faire paroistre son amour bienveillance enuers le suysses outre le vingtmille franc quil leur promet payer par le traicte de paix promet payer le an chacun de canton tant que ceste alliance durera la somme de mille liures tournois payera pareillement aux confederez la moitie de la pension quils auoient rauant one whatsoeuer make warre kingdome france duchie millaine countrey appertayning crowne france either side beyond mountaines maiestie may make leueye switzers according himselfe shall thinke conuenient witt six thousand least sixteene thousand except lord league doe permit may also make choyce canton confederate colonells captaines shall thinke meete prouided men honest good fame lord league shall occasion hinderance collonelles captaines soldiours neither delay vse fore matter whereby tardy going one within tenne dayes first day king sent warning succour shall suffered march away shall continue king seruice vntill ending warre liking without calling home lord king likewise paying accustomed wage yet notwithstanding warres happen swetia regard thereof canton cannot assist king case stand discharged promise may giue sudden countermaund people king bound giue leaue king would make warre enemy may make leueye si thousand switzers least sixeteene thousand chusing colonelles captaines men faire good shall switzers ally king may sunder army switzers place deuided troupe garrison diuers place shall serue either sea land wage gendarmerie seruitours horseback couenanted king shall pay moneth eche switz soldiour foure florin halfe hine wadges shall begin day part house shall due paye three moneths although king haue long bin serued go countrey switzerland shall handle first moneths paye rest two moneths apte meete place according shall haue neede three moneths past king would still retaine switzers shall pay hire euery moneth vntill time may conueniently returne stand engaged succour owne charge send two hundred men armes twelue piece artillerie furniture carriage quickest speede wit sixe piece batterie sixe canon moreouer shall furnish switzers three moneths three yeares fterward king henry second name sonne successour renewed league canton vpon condition father done continuance life fiue yeares couenanted soleurre e canton ally except zurich berne confederate yeare one thousand fiue hundred fortie nine alliance rticles added addition article last league qve lestat de milan autres terres vsurpees en italie sur la coronne de france du temp du roy francois premier pourroient estre recouurees par le roy sans que le y fussent tenuz de luy donner secours pour ce faire mais sil le reconquestoit laide vne autre armee que pour la conseruation dicelles lesdicts canton luy fourniroient gen lon sa volonte si le roy se veut trouuer en personne en quelque guerre il pourra choisir son plaisir de apitaines suysses faire vne leuee de six mille hommes pour le moins ne pourra desioindre separer larmee de suysses lors qu il faudra donner bataille bors dicelle il pourra le mettre en garnison par le villes place fortes ce que le traictez dalliance de annees mil cinq cent seize vingt n demeurent fermes perdurables quant aux gage non payez este pourueu comme ensuit le demandeur aduertira du faict son magistrat auquel si la cause semble estre uitable il sadressera aux ambassadeurs de sa maieste qui lors seront en suysse sils sont sent ledict magistrat escrira au roy requerra sa maieste quil satisface la partie le roy se met la raison le demandeur sen deura contenter mais sil refusoit de payer n lequite le demandeur pourra lors prier quon commette de iuges arbitres deuant quels il debattra sa cause si le roy ne commet de iuges de sa part ceux de suysse passeront outre la cogmis faict ce quils ordonneront serum tenu pour ferme valable par cha ne de comme si le iuges de part dautre auoient assiste le marchands francois suisse ne feront greuez daucuns port nges ou p s ge nouueaux sil s neut procez entre le subiects de part dautre le dema deur pl dera deuant le iuge du lieu ou demeure le deffendeur state millaine land vsurped italie crown france time king francis first may recouered king without switzers binding giue aide thereof shall reconq helpe another armie conseruation canton furnish men according owne minde king please personally present warre shall make choice pleasure switzers captaines make leuy sixe thousand men least disioyning seperation may made armie switzers giue battaile may plant garrison townes carrie equitie shall shape course ambassadours maiestie swetia absent magistrate shall write king require maiestie satisfie partie king doe yeelde reason demander rest contended refuse pay according equity demander may pray haue case committed iudges arbitrator may debate cause king doe commit part iudges switzers themselues may proceede take knowledge fact ordaine appoint shall held f rmes valuable either party iudges one side giuen assistance therein french merchant switzers shall iniuried port new toules pass suite moued law betweene subiects either side plainti e demandant shall yeelded transported christian king successours king france manner forme following breuiate treatie lyon betweene king france henry great duke sauoye tous le pais seigneury de bresse baugie veromey generalement tout e qui luy pouuoit appartenir iusques la riuiere du rosne icelle comprise de sorte que toute ladite riuiere du rosne de la sortie de geneue seroit du royaume de france ppartiendroit audit sieur roy s successeurs lesdits pais cedez ainsi que dessus toutes leurs appartenances despendances tant en souuerainete iustice seigneurie v ssaux suiects tous droicts noms raisons action quesconques sans rien reseruer demolir ny retenir delaisse pareillement ledit duc sa maieste s successeurs la baronnie bailli ge de gex auec toutes s appartenances dependance au dela du rosne le lieux terres village dayre chaussy pontdarle seyssel annully chaua pontchastel auec leurs souuerainetez iustice seigneurie tous droicts quil peut auoir en tous le lieux cedez sur le habitant diceux tous lesquels lieux cedez seront demeurer vnis incorporez la coronne de franceseront reputez domaine patrimoine dicelle de laquelle il ne pourront estre separez pour quelque occasion suiect que ce soit restituera ledit duc sa maieste le lieu valeur chastelenie de chasteaudauphi auec la tour du pont ce qui est occuppe par ledit duc le siens dependans du dauphine sans rien desmolir affoiblir ny endommager en aucune sorte delaissera tu lartillerie poudres boulets autres munition de guerre estants dedans le lieux place cedees rendra la citadelle de bourg en bresse auec toutes le piece munition sans en oster demolir endommager aucune chose fera desmolir le fort de bechedauphin et que p ia commodite du passage du pont de grezin reserue par le duc ledit duc payeroit sa maieste dans sa ville de lyon la somme de cent mille escus de trois franc piece monnoye de france ou la valeur moyennant cesdites cession transport toute l artillerie poudres munitious conquises qui demeureront entierement sa maieste ledit sieur roy se contente pour le bien de la paix delaisser transporter au sieur duc luy cede transporte luy s heritiers successeurs tous le droicts noms raisons action generalement tout ce qui p estre pretendu par le roys dauphin de france cause du marquisat de saluces appartenances dependance ensemble sur le place de cental de mont rocquespar iere sans en rien retenir reseruer et ledit sieur roy quitte remis audit sieur duc toute lartellerie munition qui furent trouuees esdites place du marquisat de saluces eu l annee mille cinq cent quatre vingts huict sa maieste remet parcillement audit sieur duc le place chasteaux de mommelian de chambery tout ce qui este pris sur ledit duc depuis ladite annee quatrev ngts huict en ce dernier voyage par sa maieste countreyes seigneury brescia baugie veromey generally appertaineth farre riuer rosne selfe therein comprised said riuer rosne issuing forth geneua shall kingdome france belong lord king successours said country yeelded aboue named appurtenance dependance well soueraigntie iustice seigneurie vassailes subiects also right name reason action whatsoeuer without reseruing thing demolishing retaining said duke likewise relinquished maiestie successours baronnie bayliwicke gex appurtenance dependance ouer ond rosne place land village dayrie chaussy pontdarle seyssell annully chaua pontchastell soueraignties iustice seigneurie right may might haue yeelded place ouer dweller surrendred place shall remaine vnited incorporated crowne france shall reputed demaine patrimonie thereof shall seperated occasion suggestion whatsoeuer said duke shall restore maiestie place worth castlewicke chasteau daulphine tower dupont vsurped said duke people dependant vpon daulphine without demollishing thing weakening endamaging sort shall relinquish artillerie powder bullet munition warre within place surrendred shall deliuer cittadell bourg brescia piece munition without taking demollishing endamaging thing shall cause demollished fort bechedaulphine commoditie passage pont de grezin reserued duke said duke shall pay maiestie within citie lyon summe hundred thousand crownes three franc piece money france value mediating grant transport artillerie powder conquered munition shall remaine intirely maiesty said king contenteth himselfe good peace leaue transport lord duke yeeldeth transporteth heires successours right name reason action generally may pretended king daulphines france regard marquisate saluces appurtenance dependance together place cen de mont rocquesparuiere without detaining armes eaking yet good la bordure de gueules chargee de huict saultoirs dor also sirname familie beare dazur au lyon dor la ordure de gueules chargee de cinq palombes dargent armes ade spanish roundelaye de palomegues memoria lignage de san benito del rey alphonso bendito en toledana victoria solar insignia notoria de los quatro toledanos palomas cinco que manos al leon dan leal gloria likewise sirname familie tolledo alli ce house portent dargent six polombes dazur aux bec alliance house tolledo et pieds de ueules also palomeques qui portent dargent deux palom lvne sur dautre dazur la bordure de gueules chargee de huict saultoirs dor iliano beare dor trois fess de gueules la bordure eschequee dor et azur de deux traicts de puerto carrero portent escheque de huict poincts dor equipolez sept dazur de gudielo like tolledo de guesada likewise sirna med tolledo alliance say mariage cernatos portent dazur deux cerfs dor lvnsuo lautre amilie haue added heereunto vne bordure de gueules huict saultoirs dor de roelas de gueules six bezans dargent chacun charge de trois faisses dazur e bezans deux en deux family founded fuensalida yned ayala renowned spayne beareth dargent deux loups de sable lvn sur lautre lorle de gueules chargee de huict saultoirs also founded great house salzedo qui portoit dar ent vn saule de synople sur lequel est eu abysme vn escu dor cinq ponceles de france saladines tenth graunted forth voyage beyond sea regard propriety money graunted king voyage beyond sea saladine called name tenth saladine graunted one yeare condition recorded rigordus follow saladines tenthes title graunted king one whole yeare maintaine warres holyland condition de decimis hoc constitutum est quod omnes crucem non habentes quicumque sint decimam ad minus dabunt hoc anno de omnibus mobilibus suis de omnibus reditibus exceptis illis qui sunt cisterciensis ordinis ordinis carthusiacensis ordinis fontisebrardi exceptis leprosis quantum ad suum pertinet proprium nullus communias mittet aliquis manum nisi ille dominus cuius ipsa communia fuerit quale autem ius aliqua communiarum habebat prius aliquis tale habebit qui alicuius terrae magnam iustitiam habet eiusdem terrae decimas habebit et sciendum est quod qui decimas sunt daturi de toto mobili suo reditibus decimas dabunt non acceptis inde prius debitis suis imo post donationem decimae de residuo poterunt sua debita soluere vniuersi laici tam milites quam alij praestito iuramento sub anathemate clerici vero excommunicatione adstricti suas dabunt decimas mile crucem non habens domino suo habenti eam cuius erit homo ligius dabit de suo proprio mobili decimam de feudo quem ipse tenebit si autem ab eo nullum tenuerit feudum de proprio suo mobili decimam domino suo ligio dabit singulis vero quibus tenebit decimam de suis feudis dabit si nullam dominum ligium habuerit ei cu u feudo manserit leuans cuban dabit decimam de suo proprio mobili si quis terram propriam decimans re alterius quam illius quam debet decimare inuenerit terra sua ille cuius re fuerint illas esse suas legitime monstrare poterit decimans non poterit ea vllomodo retinere mile crucem habens qui sit haeres legitimus filius vel gener militis crucem non habentis vel alicuius viduae habebit deciman patris vel matris suae re archiepiscoporum seu episcoporum seu capitulorum seu ecclesiarum quae ab eis mouent capite non mittet aliquis manum nisi archiepiscopi episcopi capitulum ecclesiae quae ab eis mouent si episcopi inde collegerit decimas ea dabunt quibus dare debuerint quicunque crucem habens qui dare talliam vel decimam debeat ea dare noluerit ab illo capiatur cui suam debet talliam vel decimam vt inde suam faciat voluntatem et qui eum coeperit propter hoc non poterit excommunicari qui deuote legitime sine coactione decimam suam dederit deo remunerationem accipiet concerning tenth tithe decreed haue crosse whatsoeuer shall giue yeare tenth least moueables reuenewes except order cistercian carthusian fonte eurauld leprous person also excepted far owne peculiar appertaineth man shall lay hand vpon colledges community except lord colledge belongeth also manner priuiledge one time colledges like priueledge shall haue still hath great power authority ouer countrey shall haue tithe countrie noted giue tenth tithe shall giue whole moueables reuenewes withdrawing first thence debtes rather whole yeare beyond sea well great pardon therebyyearely voyage french beyond sea honour reputation large exemption crossed deriued voyage heereupon officer king lord fiefes others beside would labour croissades one side crossed willing extend franchise longer otherwise could processe court vpon contestation party enquirie made bishop paris senlis councellers court commissioner nominated composition enquiry came decree iudge lord enquest expressing regulerly exemption crossed establishing afterward effectually case wherefore decree beareth title word contained court register establishment crossed heare may reade tearme court decree giuen easter parliament one thousand two hundred foureteene stabilimentum crucesignatorum philippvs dei gratia francorum rex semper augustus noueritis quod no per dilectos fideles nostros p parisiensem g syluanectensem episcopos ex assensu domini legati fecimus diligenter inquiri qualiter sanctum ecclesia consueuit defendere crucesignatos ipsorum cruce signatorum libertates qui facta inquisitione pro bono pacis inter regnum sacredotium vsque ad instans consilium ro anum ista volumus obscruari primo quod nullus crucesignatus burgensis vel rusticus siue mercator fuerit siue primo anno quo crucem assumpsit tallietur nisi tallia fuerit imposita prius quam cr cem assumet si primo anno imposita fuerit immunis erit secundo anno nisi aliquid accipatur pro exercitu tunc autem talliam esse impositam intelligimus quando denuntiatum est alicui vel domui suae quantum debeat soluere vel ponere tallia quia vero constat de consuetudine hactenus obtenta regno franciae quod crucesignati debeant exercitum nisi per speciale priuilegium domini regis sint exempti dicimus quod exercitu quilibet crucesignatus de praedictis dare tenetur siue cruce sign tur ante citationem siue post si tamen debeat exercitum si rex viderit expedire quod villa mittat exercitum seruientes potius quam illi qui sunt de villa vadant poterit rex accipere de exercitu de crucesignatis competenter sed habebunt de cetero crucesignati electionem eundi exercitum si voluerint vel ponendi portionem suam prisia pro redemptione exercitus facta si grauati fuerint de prisia ad diocesanum episcopum vel eius ficialem habebunt recursum si vero crucesignatus habeat possessiones quae debeant talliam reddet talliam quasi non esset crucesignatus si neget possessiones debere talliam probetur coram dioces episcopo vel eius officiali de crucesignatis manentibus communijs dicimus quod si communia aliqui accipiant propter exercitam regis vel clausuram villae vel deffensionem villae ab inimicis obsessae vel communiae debitum factum iuratum reddi antequam crucem assumerent partem suam ponent prisia sicut alij non crucesignati de debito vero contracto communia post crucis assumptionem immunis erit crucesignatus vsque ad presentem moram quandiu erit peregrinatione si bailliui dom ni regis aliquem crucesignatum deprehinderint ad praesens forefactum pro quo debeat membris mutilari vel vitam amittere secundum consuetudinem curia saecularis ecclesia non deffendet eum vel re eius alijs autem leuioribus minoribus forefactis pro quibus non debeat membris mutilari vel vitam amittere bailliuus non debet corpus crucesignati vel re eius capere vel captum retinere quin reddat absolute ipsum re suas ecclesiae requirenti eum pro iure faciendo si autem forefacto conuictus fuerit de talus forefacto pro quo debeat iuxta iudicum saecularium consuetudinem membris mutilari vel vitam amittere ecclesia nec ipsum neque re eius amplius defendet de alijs conuictus foro ecclesiae secundum consuetudinem villae emendet laeso quod si dominus rex alicui burgo vel ciuitati vel castello concesserit immunitatem exercitus si petat rex alquid de eis pro exercitu crucesignati primo anno nihil ponent de feodis autem censiuis respondeat crusesignatus coram domino feodi vel censiuae si grauatus fuerit retractet se ad episcopum vel eius officialem si vero crucesignatus conueniat quemcumque christianum super debito vel iniuria corporali sibi illata vel christiano conueniatur super praemissa electionem habeat conueniendi eum sub iudice saeculari vel ecclesiastico sub quo maluerit nullus crucesignatus tenetur respondere foro saculari sed ecclesiastico exceptis feodis censiuis de quibus litigabunt coram dominis feudorum censiuarum de possessione quam pacifice tenuerunt per diem annum obseruentur praedicta done crucesignati perfecerint peregrinationem suam si autem super negotio crucesignatorum aliquae nouae dubitationes emerserint ad praedictos episcopos recurratur ista pro bono pacis per totum domanium domini regis de crucesignatis pro terra hierosolymitana vsque ad concilium volumus obseruari saluis iure consuetudinibu regni francorum auctoritate sacrosanctae romanae ecclesiae per omnia actum parisijs parlamento anno domini millesimo ducentesimo decimo quart mense martio establishment crossed phillip grace god king france euer augustus c know ye beloued faithfull bishop p paris g senlys assent lord legate haue caused diligent inquirie bee made holy church hath bin accustomed defend crossed liberty crossed good peace shall take crosse imposed first yeare shall free second except somewhat taken armie vnderstand taxe imposed knowledge giuen one left house much ought pay put tallie manifest according custome held king shall see expedient towne village send forth seruants armie rather towne goe themselues king may take conueniently f armie crossed otherwise crossed shall haue choice going army putting portion prisage made redemption army grieued said prisage shall haue recourse bishop diocesan officiall party crossed hath possession owe tallage shall pay tallage hee crossed deny possession owe tallage let tryed bishop diocesan officiall concerning crossed abide community colledges saycommunit colledge either king army inclosing towne defence towne besiedged enemy colledge shall receiue debt made sworne repaide assume crosse shall lay part prisage others crossed concerning debt contracted colledge taking crosse crossed shall free present time staye long shall voyage king baylieffs shall take crossed dismembred loose life bailiffe ought take body good crossed retaine taken absolutely restore good church requiring iustice fact shall conuicted offence hee ought according custome secular iudges christian vpon debt corporall iniury offred vnto christian shall conuented premise let choose whether hee call secular ecclesiasticall iudge man crossed bound answer secular court ecclesiasticall fee fine excepted concerning shall commence suite lord fee fine concerning possession haue peaceably held day yeare let premise deserued vntill party crossed haue accomplished pilgrimage affaire crossed washed face hand feete according lawe prophet mahomet hee bowed body downe towards ground adoring eauen exhalting hand vp thereto king made demaund meanes may christian vse whereby make themselues maisters holy keepe defend sarrazins demand k phillip aracux much astonished demand first cry aloud returned answer conquerer answere karacux demaund king phillip augustus first recorded french englished scachez que ce iour serum la cause de la ruine totale de nostre nation puis quil est impossibile aller contre la prescience diuine que par icelle ie suis force den predir ce qui en aduiendra quelque ie vous dis que quand vous auriez acquis cette terr que vous appellez saincte que leussiez entouree dvne forte muraille de fer ou de diamant remplie de soldats indomptables comme vous en auez pour la garde di elle vous est impossibile de vous maintenir sans auoir au prealable acquis conqueste legypte vous autres chrestiens estes le plus fortz sur la mer abondez en vaisseaux hommes expert au faict de la marine il v u est fort facile de vous en rendre maistres toute legypte depend du nil cest sa muraille sa barriere sa merenourice la la borne dvn coste rendezvous en le maistres vous naurez plus de besoin de mandier le moyens de garder le royaume de hierusalem vos prince le premier roi di celuy rendirent seigneur auecques peu de force dalexandrie de pelouze sils le eussem gardees nostre religion long temp seroit exterminee priuez le egyptiens de commoditez du nil de la mer leur ostez la nauigation la grande vile du caire au toute legypt vous tendrent le main faictes autant ou plus destat dvne armee mar time que dvne terrestre cest le plus seur conseil que ie vous peux donner know therefore day cause totall ruine nation seeing impossible goe prescience diuine foreknowledge thereby forced foretell shall one day come passe tell sir hau wun land call holy shall haue engirt strong wall yron diamond filled vnconquerable soldiours haue done guard thereof impossible maintaine selfe vntill haue first wunne conquered aegypt christian strongest sea abound shipping men expert arte nauig tion easie become maisters aegypte dependeth vpon nilus h r wall barricadoe nursing mother hierusalem et de cypre que tout estat royaume estoit comparage au corp humain dont le roy faict la teste la noblesse le bra droict la iustice le gauch e le tier estat le reste quapres dieu il mettoit lasseurance conseruation de son nouuean royaume en la vaillance de ceste genereuse noblesse qui pour acquerir gloire auoit mi soubs le pieds le repos plaifirs vne vie otieuse en leur maison paternelle au doux air de la france pour courir la fortune peril de la mer viure en tout vn autre element parmy de natios incognues qui il leur donnoit le collier de lordre de lespee ayant telle esperance quils hodierna die tua concedente pietate praecingitur visibiles inuisibiles inimicos posternat conculcet victoriaque potitus maneat semper illaes per christum dominum nostrum amen sung low softly turkes suffer christian sing psalmes loud voyces church whole psalme following presented heere part benedictus dominus deus meus qui docet manus meas ad praelium digitos meos ad bellum c gloria patri filio spiritui sancto sicut erat principio nunc c saluum fac seruum tuum domine deus meus sperantem te esto ei domine turris fortitudinis facie mimici domine exaudi orationem mean et clamor meus ad te veniat dominus vobiscum cum spiritu tuo oremus domine sancte pater omnipotens aeterne deus qui cunct solus ordinas recte disponis qui ad coercenda malitiam malorum improbitatem tuendam iustitiam sum gladij terris hominibus tua salubri dispositione permisisti militarem ordinem ad populi protectionem institui voluisti quique per beatum ioannem militibus ad se n deserto venientibus vt neminem concuterent sed proprij contenti essent stipendiis dici f cisti clementiam tuam suppliciter exoramus vt sicut dauid puero tuo goliath superandi argitus e facultatem iudam machabaeum deferitate gentium nomen tuum non inuocantium triumphare fecisti ita huic famulo tuo n qui nouiter iugo militiae colla suppo pietate coelesti vires robur ad fidei spei charitatis augmentum tui timorem pariter amorem humilitatem perseuerantiam obedientiam patientiam cun ctaque eo rect disponas vt neminem cum gladio isto vel alio iniuste laedat omnia cum eo iusta rectum defendat sicut ipse de minori gradu ad nouum militatem prouehitur honorem ita veterem hominem deponens cum actibus suis nouum induat hominem vt te timeat recte colat per fidorum consortium vitet suam proximum charitatem extendat praeposito suo following cuius conditionis e ought answer without lying r nobilis genere parentibus generosis natus habesne vnde honeste manutenere possis statum militarem dignitatem absque mercimoniis arte mechanica habeo deigratia bonorum sufficientem copiam r e ne paratus corde ore iurare pro virili militaria sacramenta eaque seruare que sequuntur primo mile sanctissimi sepulchri omni die opportunitate habita missam audire debet secundo cum necesse fuerit bona temporalia vitam exponere debebit scilicet quando est bellum vniuersale contra infideles venire propria persona vel mittere duella huiusmodi nisi militaris exercitij gratia omnino vitare quinto debet pacem concordiam inter christi fideles procurare rempublicam exornare augere vidua orphanos protegere iuramenta execrabilia holy sepulcher among elect may worthily call thee eternall glory amen afterward guardian causeth golden spurres put heeles putting spur deliuereth naked sword hand saying accipe n sanctum gladium per fidem vicerunt regna guird thee n thy sword vpon thy thigh thou mighty name lord iesus christ learne know saint swordthe guirding guardian faith doe inne kingdome knight boweth downe body layeth head vpon sepulcher guardian giueth three stroaks flatlong sword vpon shoulder saying ego constituo ordino te n militem sanctissimi sepulchri domini nostri iesu christi nomine patris et filii spiritus sancti amen constitute ordaine thee n knight holy sepulcher lord iesus christ name father sonne holy ghost amenthe maner knighting making three time signe crosse kisseth afterward putteth chaine crosse gold neck done knight created sing te deum landamus making procession guardian singeth hymne reioycing ended prayer follow speciose forma prae filiis hominum r accingere gladio tuo super femur tuum potentissime domine exaudi orationem meam r et clamor meus ad te veniat dominus vobiscum r et cum spiritu tuo oremus da ecclesiae tuae miscricors deus vt sancto spiritu congregata hostili nullatenus incursione turbetur omnipotens sempiterne deus super hunc n famulum tuum vel famulos tuos many knighted qui eminenti mucrone militiae circumcingi desiderat gratiam tuae benedictionis infunde eumque dexterae tuae virtute munitum fac cuncta aduersantia coelestibus armari praesidiis quibus hoc seculo nullis bellorum tempestatibus exturbetur per dominum nostrum iesum christum qui tecum viuit regnat deus per omnia secula seculorum amen thou art fairer child men r guird thee thy sword vpon thy thigh thou mightie lord heare prayer r let cry come vnto thee lord r thy spirit receiuant profest first must prepare selfe instant houre enter paine trouble vndergoe seruice religiondepriua w must depriue selfe owne resigne submit day hand power superiours whosoeuer thereto elected commaunding obey fashion manner whatsoeuer regard contented rob selfe liberty waxecandle suffereth selfe handled made forme euen must doe moreouer let tell constrained fast haue greatest appetite feede watch would gladly sleepe suffering enduring many paine contrary pleasure libertiesfasting watching wherefore doe aduise haue full setled dispossesse selfe thereof resigne power superiours religion speake boldly freely whereunto profest ought answere thus sir haue depriued selfe thereofpleasures liberty doe resigne wholly hand superiours renounce pleasure liberty deuesting despoyling selfe heart whereunto receiuant presently thus replieth seeing haue freely dispossest selfe liberty heere presence noble assistant giue know vnderstand thus heere freely dispossessed summon tell freely confesse trueth question shall propound vpon paine reputed culpable punishment inflicted according deseruing casethe receiuants demand first demaund thee thou hast made vow religion thou hast consummated mariage bin affianced woman thou standest bound pay summe mony exceedeth thy power th n thy best faculty support satisfie thou art seruile condition quality vulgare rusticity thou hast bin preuented iustice whereto profest ought answere thing demaund way faulty receiuant saiththe receiuants final dre df position thou maist deceiued abused doe declare vnto thee time often shall discouered thou art attainted fornamed matter thou wilt instantly depriued comp ny great shame ignominie yea thou shalt deliuered hand haue power chastise thee seuerely aduise thy selfe therefore well thou art cleane free thou saist whereunto profest must answere well sir receiuant proceedeth seeing thou saist confessest thy selfe art determined prouided resolued defender church iesus christ serue poore hospitall receiued religion entertaine thee withall heartshis receiuing ord r according forme establishment custome otherwise promise thee nothing else onely pittance bread water salt poore simple garment paine trauaile receiuant commandeth missale brought causing profest lay hand vpon canon willeth pronounce word make vowe promise almightie god glorious virgin mary forme vowe promise lord saint iohn baptist patron assistance grace vowe promise obserue true obedience shall commanded god religion promise likewise liue henceforth paine trauaile obserue ghastitie behooueth catholique religious person doe swearing vowes receiuant beholding profest mildely louingly face saith acknowledge confesse thee one defender catholique church seruant poore hospitall saint iohn end thou maist begin obedience command thee bring hither missale lay vpon altar kisse altar carrie away missale profest hauing accomplished receiuant sheweth habite first crosse white cloath hauing eight point sayingthe manner deliuering crosse habite crosse thus ordained white v signification puritie ought alwayes haue within heart without free spot blemish whatsoeuer eight point wherewith crosse composed doe signifie thus made remembrance eight beatitude ought alwayes haue within vseight beatitude whereof first spirituall contentation second liue simply without maliciousnes third liue humility fourth mourne thy sinnes transgression fift loue iustice true dealing sixt mercifull seauenth pure cleane heart minde eight suffer endure affliction persecution righteousnes sake vertues thou must striue engraue fixe thy heart conseruation thy soule therefore commaund thee weare crosse openly made fast thy garment right thy heart vpon left side end thou mayest memoratiue thy heart alwayes remember former eight beatitude neuer forsake receiuant must afterward cause profest kisse crosse put cloake vpon shoulder saying putting habite take habite name blessed trinity thou shalt finde saluation thy soule thou labour augmentation christian faith defence christian dedicating thy selfe wholly seruice poore iesus christ thou maist doe place crosse heere left side neere thy heart thou maist loue thy vtmost power defend thy right hand commanding thee neuer leaue forsake true ensigne banner religion neuer wander as ciation thy brother beare thee company whatsoeuer perill daunger may ensue thereon otherwise thou must debouted society great shame reproch cast putrified member transgressour thy vowes promise conformably establishment signification habitethis cloake wherewith haue cloathed thee remembrance cammells skinne wherewith patron saint iohn baptist cloathed wildernesse taking garment thou renouncest pleasure pompes vanity world commaund thee weare requisite time thou must procure enioyne thy death thy body may buried therein thou maist better rem mber imitate follow r patrone saint iohn baptist thou must fixe thy hope haue remission thy sinnes death passion lord redeemer iesus christ figured corde thy girdle wherewith fast bound iewes seuerall attribute fitting habitesthis crowne thornes lance wherewith side pierced spundge wherewith gaue gaule vineger drinke buffettings wherewith smitten crosse whereon crucified lay vpon thy shoulder remembrance passion vnder thou shalt finde rest thy soule yoake pleasant sweete wherefore put bond cord thy neck make thee remember seruitude thou hast vowed promised vertue make thee pertaker spirituall blessing belong name religion throughout world desiring god comfort assist thee therein dayly ini nctions seruices besidethou standest obliged say dayly hundred fifty pater nosters else houres lady vigiles dead thou art likewise bound say euery one thy deceased brother one three seruices thereto especially appointed thou must alwayes bareheaded vntill time great maister lieutenant shall commaund thee put thou shalt salute embrace familiarely thou meetest wearing crosse religion token loue brotherly dilection thou wert malta thou must fetch thy bread salte water thine inne insted whereof commaund thee doe heere whatsoeuer commeth beside thou must accept order doth promise nothing else thou art receiued company shew thee coate armes vpper garment thou art weare ouer thine armour time thou marchest warre enemy faith end thou maist neuer abandon thy brother enseignes order beare noates accident soeuer shall happen thou must neuer turne thy back vpon thine enemie thing thus ended said wounted prayer required case according statute customes orderthe statute order lately imprinted newly imprinted paris put forth
